The grout between bathroom tiles were black in spots and you could see water damage on the bathroom floor The only good thing about this room was the bed was clean and comfortable, The location was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: Filthy room, unhelpful front desk staff, the worst customer service ever (especially if you are a third party booking). This hotel should be a one star, and maybe not even that in the older rooms. Not worth even the most discounted rates. Rama at front desk takes his job of denying all requests for help very seriously. Stay away form this property..

Reviews.Title: “Great location; good value”
Reviews.Author: MaryMcCartney
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel through Hotwire and after reading reviews, I was apprehensive, to say the least. However, we had a very pleasant one night stay before our flight out of LAX. The bellhop who carried our luggage both on arrival and departure was cheerful and efficient. We were also pleased with the speed and courtesy with which we were checked in. While our room was obviously not yet upgraded, it was spacious and clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: mxtravelingirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived to LAX almost at midnight. We quickly found our way to the hotel transportation area. About 10 min later we saw the Crowne Plaza and Renaissance shuttle. About 15 minutes later we were checking in with no problem. The room was clean and comfortable. Next morning we had a breakfast voucher and had the breakfast buffet. It was good, but wouldn't have taken it if we didn't had the vouchers, since I felt it was a bit overpriced. But there's a small cafe/deli in the lobby too, if you want something cheaper. I find this hotel perfect for a night stay before or after a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Sushi Bar”
Reviews.Author: Old-Lahaina
Reviews.Content: The best kept secret is the Little Sushi Bar Monday-Friday 530pm to 1030pm...Off the lobby. The best !!! With hot saki or the cold beer !!! Makes this Airport Hotel The Best !!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite honestly the worst accommodation I have ever stayed, backpackers offer better quality”
Reviews.Author: Dion K
Reviews.Content: Just don't know where to start with this one, was the most awful experiences from start to finish. Waited for over 30 minutes in Priority Club queue, there was only one person on the desk but two staff were very visible out the back and although saw me did nothing to expedite check in. Sheets on bed appeared to be used, towels in the bathroom had “bodily fluids” on them and both the bathroom and the room did not at all seem clean. Was there for 3 days, during this time carpet from my room to the lift was covered in crumbs and dirt and did not appeared to get vacuumed at all. I needed a bottle opener; called room service, the bar and the front desk no one could find a solution. Called the duty manager who didn’t seem too interested but eventually, and begrudgingly, she arranged an opener for me. I complained to the duty manager about the experience in cleanliness and the overall quality of stay and was offered a $5 credit on a previous purchase at the bar. If this is how ICH treat their most valuable guest then I will be steering well clear of them in future.

Reviews.Title: “The tructh about this budget airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: grouchob
Reviews.Content: Came here on the day that New York Airport was first closed because of the impending hurricane attack. We were sent here by the Continental staff at LAX. Expected the worst- an extra 2 days in a budget airport hotel before flights to UK! Then the reality- a great hotel- pretty basic room compared with others we had stayed in, but a good price and great facilities including freshly cooked food at any time of the day. Outside there was a great bus service to the fabulous Manhattan Beach which we used for both of our extra days in LA. I can't understand the negative comments. This was a great hotel with a reliable complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport. We had great food, and a very enjoyable forced extension to our US experience. Many thanks Crowne Plaza!!

Reviews.Title: “Same place, different date.”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Mingle
Reviews.Content: Nothing extraordinary about the hotel, kinda dated. I bidded for a room on three different occasions and each time was given the same room on the 5th floor at the end if the hall. I don't know if its specifically reserved for 'bidders' but it seems to be. Imagine my surprise the first time I stayed there to discover a $12 plus per day parking fee. So what I thought was a great deal for the room wasn't really.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever ;(”
Reviews.Author: PilgrimStranger
Reviews.Content: I love to write reviews about great service, kindnesses rendered, exceptional care--this will not be one. It is my first negative comment review ever! I don't see how I can have the right words to even begin to give it justice. My husband and I travel internationally about 50 weeks out of the year, often we need a late check in at an LAX hotel in prep for an early flight. Our teams usually us the Westin but though we would take the luck of the draw with an Expedia Unpublished rates deal and check out another choice. We got the Crowne Plaze, which we though was great as it we have one we have used at home in Singapore. We checked in late, very tired, returned the rental car and were given room 1501. After popping into bed we realized the constant roaring noise was not going to stop all night-it was coming from outside the building. It was late, we were in bed, we had an early flight, we didn't want the hassle of moving. In the a.m. when I went to check out and the desk clerk asked me how it was... I didn't say but asked for a comment card. She said let my ears be your comment. So I said there was a loud noise all night and we didn't sleep well, she said it was the signage on the building. They knew about it. I said we probably wouldn't be back. Just then an older man, perhaps some sort of manager or supervisor come out and she said to him, "She isn't coming back because of 1501." He spoke from quite a distance away in a loud voice saying that lots of customers request that room. I said I wouldn't have. He said, "Well you could have asked to be moved." I said yes we could have, but if you all know it, why did you give us the room to start with? I tried to get away and being nice said... it wasn't convenient...we had lots of luggage, it was late at night, etc. Then, still speaking in a loud voice without coming over to talk to me he said, "Well we do have luggage carts ma'am." And proceeded to say it was my fault I didn't sleep well, etc. I didn't bring it up, I wasn't complaining and he rebuked me for not sleeping well. It was awful. I won't ever go there again and our corporations and staff will never use such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is epitome of a stereotype airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel showed a listing of 3.5 stars on Hotwire.com, but the dirty, discusting room should result in a 2 star rating. It was really a dirty room with hair in the bathroom, soiled carpet not worthy of nice slippers (lol) let alone bare feet. There are other hotels in the area, some I have reviewed, that will give you a better room. I would pick the Marriott, Hilton, Westin or a couple other ones before this place. The best part was the airport shuttle that got me off property in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “much better then originally thought”
Reviews.Author: markalanh
Reviews.Content: the people the facility and the price all made for a great stay. try it you'll like it !

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: DaveF1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for LAX.... just seconds drive from Terminals. Aircraft noise was not a problem. Close to 405 freeway also, and also shops, services on Sepulveda Blvd. Rooms and halls were a litte dated, but were clean and comfortable. Wifi though was very expensive, and parking rates for hotel guests were actually higher than the standard daily rate for the car park! (Only advantage being you can obviously come and go throughout the day).

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: MarciaLynn4
Reviews.Content: I needed to catch an early LAX flight, so stayed here because they have 24/7 shuttle. I was able to drop my car off at Avis LAX the night before, they have an agreement with AVIS that they will drop you off at the hote (...I did tip the Avis guy). Check in was with a long line, alot of flight/airline people checking in. Key did not work on first try, had to come back, not the friendliest staff. But, will stay here again, great location.

Reviews.Title: “A fine experience!”
Reviews.Author: ElizaChris
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay between a cruise and a Mexican vacation. Beautiful interior and quick check in especially with Priority Club. Room and bath were both clean and decorated very nice. Bed was comfy and cozy but the pillows were too small for the bed. Small square-ish and not comfortable to use at all. Staff was great and very accomodating. Offered suggestions for restaurnts in the area and directions. Bar service charged me $17.50 for one vodka and cranberry...yes ONE. Airport shuttle runs every few mins and that was a breeze. Overall, our stay was short and sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kabir N
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concern reading some negative reviews prior to my check in; but my perception changed 100% as soon as I arrived. The front desk staff was very helpful and courteous especially Imelda she made me fell welcome and went the extra mile. The lobby is clean and welcoming; the room was very nice and clean with a very comfortable bed and pillows. I would defiantly recommend Crowne Plaza LAX to my friends and Family. Thank you for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite LAX hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BicoastalBunny
Reviews.Content: I am in LA every other week and I've stayed at most of the higher end hotels by the airport. Without a doubt, the Crowne Plaza is the best. The remodeled rooms are beautiful, so ask for a room on one of the remodeled floors. If you aren't Platinum, it's worth the $$ to pay for access to the club lounge on the 16th floor. A good breakfast each morning and free beer/wine/food each night. The staff are all exceptional with special kudos to Marina and Ralph at the front desk and Tony, the attendee in the club lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the airport poor for quality”
Reviews.Author: imduk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for connections to the airport, unfortunately that's all the positives done . The hotel needs upgrading - as a crown plaza goes this hotel is very tired- the rooms are large - bed linen is clean but looks like it needs a boil wash. The club level - lounge - very poor - infact no comfort - weekends not open, so no point in paying extra for club facilities . The air-conditioning is the old fashioned units - you have the choice of hot or freezing - unfortunately the aircraft taking off outside produce less noise than these ac units - before checking here please check alternatives around the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Jackson B
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline. When we got there, they asked if we wanted to upgrade to a recently refurbished room, for an extra cost. When we declined they must have given us the worst room in the hotel. The room was old and filthy. The carpeting was disgusting and the bathroom was moldy. Was glad we were only there one night. Priceline rated this hotel a 3.5 star, and it may be in their newly remodeled rooms, but, in the old rooms it is not even 2 star. There is nothing in the area and parking on the street to avoid the steep parking fee seemed dangerous. The only saving grace was a starbucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniant business hotel”
Reviews.Author: salmonsma
Reviews.Content: Date of stay 10/09/2011 & 23/09/2011 Clean and comfortable. The hotel is mainly geared to business travellers, but were perfectly welcoming to a pair of slightly bewildered holiday makers. The hotel is right by the airport. So, to state the obvious, it is nice and quick to get to after a long flight and long queues at immigration. The hotel has a shuttle I think every 15 mins. Stating the obvious again; there will inevitably be plane noise, although this was not as intrusive as I had expected. 1st night offered upgrade to room with King-size bed. All fine except that coffee machine did not work well = had to stay with it and hold switch. Unfortunately we forgot to mention this when we checked out, so apologies to the next guests in that room. 2nd night again only problem was that there was only enough coffee for 1 person, reception happily provided more. We ate in the restaurant both evenings: The menu seemed to be more extensive the first night. The food was good, but portions far too large for my appetite. If you like Jazz plan to stay on a Thursday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidTMike
Reviews.Content: It is often hard to find a good hotel near the airport as the foot travel tends to be people staying only one night. But, the Crown Plaza was a very pleasant stay. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and the Internet was fast. It was inexpensive for LA standards. The shuttle to the airport was quick and easy. The restaurants downstairs were good and the room was nice. I did have one of the remodeled rooms. All in all, if you are in LA and need a place near the airport for a quick service to LAX, you can't ask for better than the Crown Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: willworkforhotelroom
Reviews.Content: My friend picked this hotel from a handful on hotels near the Los Angeles Airport (LAX). What a mistake! Even being one of those people who try to focus on positives in my hotel reviews, I came up blank regarding this hotel. Perhaps the only redeeming aspect during our stay was the voucher for a free Starbucks drink at the restaurant downstairs [one free drink for four people...nice going]. Otherwise, this ranks as one of the top five shabbiest hotels at which I've stayed. It was disappointing from top to bottom: dingy carpets along the hallway and in our room. Upon checking in and walking to our room, there were at least four wine glasses (not fully empty) left along the hallway, which were not cleared at least until our checkout the next morning. The room was so musty that we were forced to open some windows to air out the room. Rusting faucets in the sink and in the bathtub added allure, along with cracked tiles and caulking. It seems that the TV had time-travelled from the 1950s to join us; the duvets and sheets came from that era as well, along with holes and stains. The parking was about $14, which was slightly ridiculous considering the long-ish walk with luggage to the entrance of the hotel [compared to other hotels associated with parking structures]. While the staff did consider our requests, they did so begrudgingly, which detracted very much from good customer service. I rarely come away from a hotel thinking, "I would never stay there again." But this is one of them. For the amount we paid, we could have stayed at almost any other hotel and gotten better amenities and service. If you're looking for a hotel around LAX, I'd look for a different place than Crowne Plaza LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Not too pleased...”
Reviews.Author: ccwhite
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here before the supposedly remodeling and hated every minute! When my friend checked in the person that checked us in was not helpful, the way the place looked and smelled was not what they "pretend" to be a 3.5 star hotel at all...The room was not really nice nor very clean. Had dinner, our food was cold waiter was almost non existant. We probably wouldve been better at some motel and dennys....yuck! Just booked a reservation on priceline for this weekend, and what do you know...I get to be miserable again...yay me! Probably never doing priceline again....

Reviews.Title: “3 1/2 Stars?”
Reviews.Author: 1234Hel
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money. It was clean and the location was good but the place is in need of serious updates.

Reviews.Title: “The best Business-Ready Hotel and Service I had in Los Angeles or anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: EnricoDePaoli
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through the online booking website DECOLAR.COM. They made a huge mistake and when I arrived at the Crowne Plaza, my reservation was not there. I was helped by the frondesk manager and clerk RALPH and TERI. They took care of the situation immediately, even before they could confirm I actually had a pre-paid reservation. Ralph sorted everything out and placed myself and my girlfriend into a great, comfortable and business-ready room. If it wasn't for them, I'd have to solve all of this myself, outside of the hotel, after an almost 20-hour long flight. Thank you, Ralph and Teri. You made our trip the best! Aside from that, the hotel was perfect. Rooms were excellent. Full of ac outlets everywhere for our phone and computers. Great parking. Great location and a perfect Starbucks at the lobby !!! My only suggestion is...: for such a great business-ready hotel, it makes no sense to have to pay internet on the side... my opinion. Hope to be back soon. Best to you! Enrico De Paoli

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Trantini
Reviews.Content: We were just looking for a hotel near the airport. We found the hotel to be very nice, the staff friendly and informative, and the proximity to the airport very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room”
Reviews.Author: topnotch_10
Reviews.Content: If you find yourself stuck at LAX overnight or just looking for a conveniently located hotel on the westside, consider the Crowne Plaza. Recently renovated rooms are very comfortable, staff is very accommodating and the in house restaurants are better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good food!”
Reviews.Author: Hooleys
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks in the states, I was desperate for vegetables - the steak and veg were cooked to perfection. With hindsight, we would have based our LA stay here - clean, comfortable rooms, free shuttle to the airport, super service in the restaurant, friendly reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: lakini
Reviews.Content: We did a park and fly and stayed at this hotel. Room and restroom were clean and soundproof room was great. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth three stars, but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: harry1901
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not bad, but not worth three stars. Ask for a room above the 6th floor because the noise of the airco from de groundfloor is really load (airplanes are not worse). Beware: no fridge, microwave or breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Got a renovated room and it was fab”
Reviews.Author: angelbunny
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 or 4 times over the last few years, and in the past the service & convenience has made it worthwhile, despite the scuffy carpets & wallpaper, and dull brown decor in the rooms being something to try to ignore. This time got a renovated room with sleek black/white theme, everything fresh and bright,comfy bed, non-noisy A/C, flat screen TV - - a very happy stay. The only caveat is that this 9th floor southerly-situated room with a beautiful view of the LAX runways does pick up the sound of jet roar, very particularly at night. But since I love the sound of jets and they put me to sleep like an lullabye it wasn't an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are so friendly and professional. You are made to feel truly special.”
Reviews.Author: Rupert74_11
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at reception the staff were so helpful, friendly and professional. I had only just joined the Priority Club 2 days earlier at a Holiday Inn Express hotel in Idaho and had not received a temporary card. The Crowne Plaza staff member looking after me soon rectified this for me, and also gave me a voucher for a complimentary wine, beer of coffee AND was upgraded to the priority club floor of the hotel. I used room service on 3 occasions and not only were the staff incredibly friendly but the food was sensational. I highly recommend the salmon for dinner! I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “stone in lobby 3.5 stars does NOT make”
Reviews.Author: urban-anthro
Reviews.Content: under no theory or scale is this a 3 1/2 star hotel. It is closer to a motel. Worn room. Blanket/duvet had holes. OLD OLD if not dirty, kind of rusted and encrusted bathroom. Sub Motel 6 where their fixtures may not be high end, they are new and fresh. Had to use laundry. very dirty and broken dryer. Staff was helpful, but I may never use priceline again. Presenting and selling this property as 3.5 stars is quite deceptive. many other choices at that price point or below at LAX that would be far better value/experience

Reviews.Title: “They try but don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Clare L
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a renovated room and had access to the Club Floor of the Crowne Plaza at LAX. I won't stay again. Service was good and the room decor had been redone recently . But in summary - the room was noisy! You could hear the planes take off and land (which in most airport hotels you can't) plus you could also hear noise from room to room. The club room on the top floor was not much to look at either. Breakfast was limited - I've had better options at a Days Inn. On the plus side - the restaurant downstairs made great woodfired pizzas!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back one day...”
Reviews.Author: 9W21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza LAX for family reunion this year, it was close to the airport and great for family, no one really needed a car. I still believe I saw Actor Ed Harris in a tux coming out of the hotel as I was getting off the airport shuttle. Front desk was accomodating and polite. The lobby was decent sized and the kids got a kick out of a Krispey Kreme in the lobby. Infomation booth team was exceptional, we didn't want to pay a taxi to go to Venice Beach, it was fun to take the buses, mingle with the natives. The room? The room was okay. Rugs worn but passable. Walls worn, bedding had a stain on the outside of the covering. I did use the gift spray the first nite to freshen the room. T'was a little bothered that the window was open and I was on the 7th floor. I had a great view of the planes taking off and landing at the airport but they didn't disturb my sleep. A few of the family were able to take advantage of the new upgraded rooms and they are beautiful. This hotel will be fabulous when the upgrades are completed. They had live latin jazz music on the Thursday we were there and that made the night! All in all I will take advantage when I return to LA. It's a very nice hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay If Leaving Out of LAX!”
Reviews.Author: marivi90804
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an early morning flight out of LAX to Hawaii in late July, 2011. We could have stayed home and have a shuttle pick us up. We decided to treat ourselves and stay by the airport the night before our departure. After a wonderful dinner at Truxton's American Bistro, we checked into the Crowne Plaza. Check in was a breeze. Within minutes, we were going up to our room. We had a large, spotlessly cleaned room with a comfy king size bed. The bathroom was ample for two people to use. We went downstairs and had a night cap in their lounge. Excellent service. The next day, we grabbed our complimentary paper with our coffee and went off to find the shuttle. We gave ourselves extra time in case the shuttle was running late. We could have stayed in bed for an additional half hour. The shuttle pulled up exactly on time. It took minutes to get to LAX. This is a perfect location if you need quick access to the airport. Thanks, Crowne Plaza! We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: feldtj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while on vacation in LA. Rooms were very nice and staff was friendly and helpful. We did not find the location to be as inconvenient as we expected. Would definitely recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for 3 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Draude8
Reviews.Content: Very close to the airport (between the runways), they provide free and very eficient shuttle every 15 minutes. The check in was fast and the front desk people very nice. The room is, like many other said, a litle "tired" with old tube tv and stained carpet, but I understood they started the renovations and is supposed to be in good shape soon. Even like this I found the house-keeping do their best and clean the room each day ( I stayed there 3 days). Good restaurant and pizzeria downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Busisiwe0403
Reviews.Content: Not the best location if you planning to stay in LA for vacation. These airport hotel only work if you really need to be close to the airport, for whatever reason, which was not the case with me. Next time I will book in downtown LA and Century City area, which I've stayed in the past and enjoyed more than this location. Also they need to do something about the carpets. I stayed on the third floor and there was a terrible smell that hits you as soon as you walk out the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Crowne Plaza?”
Reviews.Author: jkhotels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza LAX for a one night layover on the way back to San Jose. With it's close proximity to the airport, this was our choice, merely based on that. The problem is, it was not a good choice due to many cons. Being an IHG employee, I can not believe that a Crowne Plaza of this nature has even past inspection and flagship is still in tact! Starting with the pro's: - 24 hour shuttle through the airport will bring you directly to the hotel every 20 minutes. - Gentlemen working the guest service desk on August 5 at 3pm recommended us to an amazing Thai food restaurant and was very helpful Now the long list of con's: - Checked in with Len and asked her for a great room. The normal saying when you go to a high end hotel to make sure you get what you pay for. Problem is she found it funny that there were bad reviews on Tripadvisor and that heavily stained carpets were nothing. It could be that we were staying on an employee rate, but if she gave my party the sass we received, wonder what she is like with others. **** ROOMS RENOVATED AT $20 EXTRA. If you do not pay the extra $20 please keep reading. - Desk chair was stained and broken, wires exposed everywhere in the room, phone was sticky and dirty, coffee maker in the room was broken and missing a filter tray to actually make coffee, carpets stained, lock on door broken with the handle and chain lock loose, AC unit kept letting air out with what smells similar to cat litter and cleaning supplies (when the heat was accidentally switched on, a foul burning smell stuck in the room), window was beat up with the frame bent and molding covers gone and glue exposed, shower tiles were cracked, grout everywhere had stains of all different colors, heavy water buildup on shower head, towels were so frayed and worn that they look worse than the ones at car washes, and the last, of probably will not be the last, is that the counter to the bathroom was cracked and a heavily applied yellow substance was still oozing out of the crack. Had a horrible night sleep with a loud AC vent, barely sleeping before my early morning flight. Check out attendants are not any better because they are what I would describe the hotel, tired and lacking a good quality of a Crowne Plaza. In the end will NOT recommend this hotel to anyone! Will not be back because there are tons of hotels in the area, and even another Crowne Plaza near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: pb4y
Reviews.Content: Close to airport, fast friendly checkin,clean rooms. This is a great hotel that is close to the airport. The shuttle service is a common use shuttle used by many hotels, so they stop at every stop. If you are in a hurry and don't mine a little exercise, I would walk from the airport to the hotel. The rooms are well appointed and have flat screen tvs and many outlets. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “filthy rooms with bad customer service!”
Reviews.Author: talimali
Reviews.Content: Upon entering guest room, we immediately encountered foul odor; the carpets were extremely dirty, the furniture including the desk and chair had greasy food markings and smell. The toilet and shower were grossly stained...made a complaint and asked for another room but they rudely stated that they had no other rooms available. We almost checked out, but because it as 11:00 pm we somewhat had no choice but to bear it. The next morning, we encountered other rude workers as well. We asked the Bell Desk to hold our bags for half an hour so we can have breakfast at the restaurant, they said they couldn't because they were busy, but when we argued about the lack of service, they just grabbed our bags and shoved it in the back storage room. We had stayed at other Crowne Plazas before and were very satisfied, but we will NEVER stay here again. EVER. .

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: sloflt
Reviews.Content: Actually, I have stayed at this hotel many times. Because they do such a wonderful job every time, I decided it was time to give them the credit they deserve. Some of my stays are business and I receive the special rates for professional pilots. As many times, I stay as a regular guest (no rate). I have received the same quality service, regardless of the type of stay. The most recent visit (July 24th thru July 27) was again a most pleasant experience. My better half came over from Hawaii to join me for my birthday. From the check-in (I am a priority club member), the valet parking, the restaurant, to the check-out, it was a perfect experience. I reserved two rooms and the front desk personnel gave us adjoining rooms without my requesting it (I forgot). I do stay at this hotel whenever I'm in town, but I'm still pleasantly surprised when I get a "Hi, how are you, nice to see you again" and that is from staff that isn't waiting on me. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the bar and restaurant food is spectacular (I travel all over the world and I would go out of my way to eat here), the service is great and the check-out was easy. Almost forgot the valet parking - a nice crew and my car was always there when I wanted it Yes, I plan on staying at the Crown Plaza, LAX many more times.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad for such a major hotel chain...”
Reviews.Author: BAW9DV
Reviews.Content: My family and I had orginally booked this hotel for four nights after entry plans into the United States had to be changed. I should preface this review by saying that we got Airline staff rates which were much cheaper than normal - however this does not justify what we found when we stayed there. We had a double room (two double beds, one for me and my wife and one for the two kids) on the 15th floor of the hotel in what was supposed to be the "quiet" area. The room was fine but it took us a while to work out the A/C since the unit had controls that did not work - until we discovered that they were in fact redundant and the room control unit was on the wall! The room itself was fine except that we were right above runway 25 left at LAX. Great for plane spotters but really loud if you want to sleep. Clearly, the windows were not soundproofed and I was surprised to find flights taking off still around 1:30 in the morning! When we booked this hotel, I was told that breakfast was inclcuded for the two adults but the children would incur a fee. This was similar to the arrangement we had at the Sheraton Four Points in San Diego where we flew into the US before we arrived here. Actually, for a buffet breakfast where my kids did not eat much, we were charged $63! I queried the bill and the hotel stated that British Airways rates did not include breakfast! I was not happy. In the end, the Resturant Manager agreed to reduce the bill to $40. Still not happy about that really. By the way - the Pool? Don't bother. Its a postage stamp! The thing is on the second floor and so small that when the people sitting at the far end start smoking, the kids get irritable in the pool at the far end! And we had to wait ages for replacement towls to be delivered while we shivered by the pool, which itself is in shade most of the time because it is between two buildings - which also means that there is a fairly strong wind around most of the time. Parking the rental car on the hotel property costs $13.75 which is reasonable, despite the fact that at the Sheraton in San Diego it was free! To be honest I expected much more from this hotel as I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza in the UK both at Heathrow and in Chester where the service and prices were impeccable. But the hotel here at LAX was pretty bad considering. Even the lady who sold me the road map in the gift shop was rude when I stated that the map only showed LA north of the airport and I wanted to see the south part. Overall, not the sort of place I will be staying in again. It is fine for quick proximaty to LAX but as a hotel for any lengthy stay, I will be looking elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Atmosphere- Great Park And Fly”
Reviews.Author: terrynkathy
Reviews.Content: Parking Structure is next door to the hotel and covered. The Park N Fly Program was very reasonably priced and the shuttle reliable and frequent. A very clean and fresh feeling hotel. I particularly appreciate Crowne Plaza's Quiet Zone. A complete floor dedicated to those who care for peace and quiet. Even Housekeeping keeps the noise to a minimum. The special gift bag placed on the bed offers linen spray, ear plugs and a sleep mask. There has always been an extra special something when we check into a Crowne Plaza and this one is no exception. After missing a personal item on my trip, I realized I had left it at the hotel. Seven days later I returned and they had it waiting for me. It was an expensive item and I greatly appreciated housekeeping's honesty.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good stay before family vacation out of LAX”
Reviews.Author: Chillmack
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this hotel before our vacation which is real close to LAX.Park and fly package.I requested a room looking out towards south runways so we can watch planes land and take off.It was granted no problem.Club level employee was really cool poured my juice and coffee and served up a great breakfast burrito.While the club level rooms dont look like they have been renovated yet we had no problems with our stay.The complimentary boarding pass kiosk wasnt working properly but was quickly remedied by concierge guy. Pure airport hotel not much to do in surrounding area.We just hung out in the pool and hottub and had great in room dining and got ready for early flight out next morning.Shuttle was prompt in departutre and arrival. *Tip* If you choose park and fly and park in the garage across the street two options for shuttle. Hotels and the parking structures shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, very comfortable. Take the bus to Manhatten Beach.”
Reviews.Author: bobandpat39
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great position, lovely area and very quiet. Following a suggestion from the concierge we caught the red Ocean Trolley bus $5 each from outside the hotel to Manhattan Beach where we had a walk then on the bus again to Manhattan Village for another stop and back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: john_ecko
Reviews.Content: i got this hotel pretty cheap. we only stayed here because the other hotels in LA were very expensive. this was a lovely hotel and considering we had 2 rooms at the end of the hotel on the 12th floor which looked onto the runway you couldnt hear the planes coming in 24/7 its located on century boulevard, we had a car in LA which i would highly recommend and it wasnt far to the beaches and around 30 mins from hollywood. clean and modern rooms and prices of food and drink were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of a remodel”
Reviews.Author: madimacmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the airport and has a beautiful lobby. That's it for positive, our room was dated and filthy. The carpet was so gross, we wouldn't take our shoes off. Very noisy room, lots of traffic noise and door slamming. We won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: JAE2512
Reviews.Content: This was the most dirtiest hotel we have EVER stayed at. The room had an overwhelming smell of mold/mildew and cigarette smoke. The carpets were disgusting and stained. We requested two beds because we were traveling with our son. We received one king size bed. We spoke with management and she was of very little help and very unprofessional. I will never bring my family here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: chilanga24
Reviews.Content: This is a expensive one but the is nothing good about this hotel only that is near the intenational airport, the rooms was dirty and smells very bad, the rooms have to be remodelated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: DutchieGirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel about 5hrs late (at 4am in the morning) due to my flight out of NYC being delayed because of bad weather. My booking had of course been cancelled by that time, but the gentleman at the check in desk found me a room and offered me late check out (2pm) which I was greatful for as I thought I'd sleep most of the morning. Got to my room and it was clean. The bed was comfortable. The room had a view out onto a main road, but it is an airport hotel that you don't go to for the view, and I had no problem with traffic noise. I ended up waking up around 9:30am the next morning and decided to have a shower and go to breakfast (which was supposed to be available until 11:00am). By the time I got down to the breakfast room it was about 10:20am and it was empty. I had to wait a minute before someone noticed that I was there and I asked if I could have some breakfast. I was told the breakfast buffet had already finished, but I didn't want the buffet anyway, i just wanted some eggs on toast and juice. They accommodated me while they were setting up for lunch. Breakfast was good - massive plate of eggs and steak (not sure if it's the same everywhere in the US, but the steak was so fatty that I could not eat it - but I am picky about meat anyway). Cost was reasonable considering I was staying at a Crowne Plaza (about USD$18 total inc drink, tax, tip). The hotel also has a cafe that sells snacks all day also at a reasonable cost. As I was awake I went to ask the concierge what there was to do around the area as my flight did not leave till about 10pm that evening. He suggested paying $5 (round trip) to take the "trolley" (it's just a bus with wooden seats) to Manhattan Beach. I did do that and it was a great suggestion. You can get off either in the main town area (near the beach), or go to either of the two malls a little further on. Overall this hotel is reasonably priced and I had no problems with the room or the staff. I assume they mostly get people staying for 1-2 nights on arrival or at the end of their holidays as the hotel is by the airport (free shuttle to and from airport) and there is not much to do around the area and it's not close to any of the usual tourist sites in LA, but I will definetely go back there at the end of my next trip to the US.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast buffett with the freshest, tastiest fruit near LAX!”
Reviews.Author: changrcc
Reviews.Content: OK... if you can handle the occassional aircraft landings and take-offs at this hotel a few blocks away from LAX, then you don't want to miss their breakfast buffett, especially the incredible in-season fruit. After a two week jaunt around China, and needing an overnight near LAX for the final leg back home... we weren't expecting much but a convienent room close enough to LAX... which we found; but to our huge surprise, the breakfast buffett was a spectacular find! Yes, all of the usual fare was on display... but the real kicker was the service... flat out, we felt pampered from the moment we walked into the breakfast room to the time we paid the bill... and the over the top BEST was the freshest, tastiest fruit I've had in a long, long time! Bottomline, try it out if you're ever in the LAX area and need a new option for breakfast... and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to family & friends, Manager is the best”
Reviews.Author: Cherie62
Reviews.Content: It was a very stressful time for my family. We reserved a room through a third party and found out only the person who's name is on the reservation needed to be physically present. This did not work for us as the reservation was in my husbands name. He could not make the trip as he had to stay with his grandmother who just had surgery. It could have been very inconvenient to have to get another hotel, not to mention this was a pre-paid room. The manager was very empathetic to my problem and helped me resolve this issue in a very expedient manner. This set the tone for the visit. I had a great, restful stay at the Crown Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Employee”
Reviews.Author: LarryandSandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Concierage Floor at the hotel and enjoyed the company of the Concierage Host whose name was Tony. Tony went out of his way to welcome us and to make sure we had drinks and snacks. He even shared his salsa recipe with us which he had made for that evening. Tony is certainly an employee who enjoys his job and makes everyone welcome! Thanks Tony!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow What a great place to meet”
Reviews.Author: CJ3222
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! What a great place for a conference. I attend more than my fair share of conferences and I have to say I am totally impressed with this facility. The room was clean and the housekeeping staff was polite and respected my space. The food was out of this world. The food presentation was awesome. Check in was good and everyone was welcoming. I would not do the food team justice if I didn’t mention that the food had taste, the display was creative and selection was many

Reviews.Title: “TONY”
Reviews.Author: 12Shasta
Reviews.Content: Tony in the Permier Club Lounge 16 th floor took good care of us after a long day. Must go see Tony

Reviews.Title: “Will look for better next trip.”
Reviews.Author: hackney1
Reviews.Content: Had several problems: elevator requires key card but card reader was broken. Asked for at the front desk, I received only a dirty look as the lady checked in the next guest. Get in line! Waited 15 minutes in the restaurant after being seated, no one spoke to me, they were all running around like maniacs, so I left. Room is from the early 90's, even has the 21" tube TV! Very noisy, traffic, noise from other rooms. Gee, even plane noise passes right thru the window. Tile around tub is ready to fall off as the backing swells from years of moisture. Highlights are few, bed was ok, room was fairly clean. Internet is free for Priority Club members. Speed was very good on download, upload was horrendous and dial up slow! (8.6/0.1Mbps)

Reviews.Title: “No more than one night is enough.”
Reviews.Author: 2peregrinators
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this airport hotel is the lobby restaurant. For the three days and two nights, the room card keys had to be reset three times. The room's bathroom ventilation was close to nonexistent. However, short stay is tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for a layover”
Reviews.Author: tammynnc
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as I had a quick overnight this week as I had a short layover at LAX. I'm PC Plat and was upgraded I was told but really didn't make use of it as I was at the hotel for less than 6 hours total. The room was acceptable, the bed was acceptable and the staff were acceptable. That is about as good as it got. I might stay here again if a short layover but probably wouldn't recommend it for a vacation hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hobbspsk
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel that I had contact with was very professional. Someone that stood out even among the friendly staff here was the front desk employee Marina! Marina was so gracious at check in and very helpful. I had to visit the front desk several times during my two night stay and i was happy to see Marina each time. I have to travel every week and it is so refreshing to have someone as professional and gracious as Marina to make make my time away from home more pleasant. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice rooms. We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: LMIURA
Reviews.Content: We had a business meetings there and we chose Crowne Plaza because we heard their meeting spaces are very flexible and were impressed with their meeting planners. The meetings went very smooth. The catering dept. and the food services were excellent. After the meeting, the guest room was nice and the bed is so comfortable. l love the quiet zone and concierge lounge. There was a FREE bus rides to local beaches (Manhattan Beach) and to the shopping centers. We did not need a taxi or a car (saved lot of money.) We will be back, it was excellent. Oh, they have a Starbucks and an excellent restaurant on the lobby level. LM

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice rooms, we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: taikolily
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay at the Crowne. After a long hard day at work, I really wanted to come back to a nice room. I love their comfortable bed, tasfully decorated room. I was tired so I decided to eat at the restaurant, wow, it was a top-notch dining experience. I travel a lot and I'm a foodie so I know my stuff. Best of all they have a nice Jazz lounge next to the restaurant and had a well known professional Jazz group. Hey, I recommend this hotel. Crowne is always nice but this property was exceptional. Eriko M

Reviews.Title: “Choose a different Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: judibca
Reviews.Content: I purchased a club level room at the Crown because it was suppose to include high speed internet, a refrigerator and access to the club for a quick breakfast. I paid extra for this room and yet when I checked in there was no refrigerator in the room, the club is closed on the weekend (even though the hotel does not tell you that at the time of booking) and the hotel charged me for computer access. I moved rooms because I needed a refrigerator and because of the move they charged me for internet access even though I specifically asked if it would still be included and I was assured it would. To me this is the epitimy of deception. I did not get what I paid for. There are many nice hotels at the airport and I have stayed at many of them and have never been ripped off like this by the other hotels.. Other minor annoyances; the front desk check in girls were chatting back and forth in a language other than English (rude) I think it is inappropriate when you are checking guests in. Speak in your own language in the break room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting and outdated”
Reviews.Author: scarlettmcd
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I missed a connecting flight to Toronto on May 23. American Airlines gave us a number to call that suggested hotels within the area offering discounted rates. They made a reservation for us at the Crowne Plaza LAX for one night for a discounted rate of $89. The shuttle arrived promptly so things were looking good. The location was fantastic and we were there in no time. We got to the hotel around midnight and the lobby looked nice. And that was it for good stuff. The front desk staff weren't particularly friendly and didn't move particularly fast given that there was a big lineup of people who had just arrived on our shuttle. We got checked in and the elevator looked really nice. We get off the floor and it was old and outdated. Somebody had thrown their takeout out into the hall and it would still end up being there the next morning. Getting into our room we discovered we had paid $88 too much. The room was old and outdated. The furniture was worn and scratched. The sheets had holes in them and the carpet was stained everywhere. There was dust all alond the edges of the carpet. The window was open god knows why - maybe airing it out. The internet was paid and it was expensive. I was shocked to read the regular, non-discounted prices printed on the back of the door. Surely they must be joking. We slept with the light on and checked out at the crack of dawn to get out of there. I didn't take my shoes off and still would have slept in my clothes even if I had had my luggage with me. I seriously question the favourable reviews on this site because this place was gross. It's obvious that the Crowne Plaza LAX preys on those stranded on layovers who are only in town for one night and don't care about repeat business. I wouldn't let my dog sleep in this hotel and as a result I will never look twice at another Crowne Plaza in any other city on future trips. We should have slept at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Windfeld-C
Reviews.Content: We chose Crowne Plaza over the Holiday Inn nearby despite the relatively bad reviews for Crowne Plaza on Tripadvisor. We have spent several nights at other CPs around the US before and thought that we'd give it a chance. We parked and checked in. Or rather - tried to check in. We stood in line for 45 minutes and were met by an arrogant woman at the front desk with no servicemindedness at all. She couldn't find our voucher, which was faxed over earlier that day. And the fax had been confirmed by the travel agency. Since it took 45 minutes to check in we missed the cocktail lounge for club floor guests. We got a room on the top floor, which was nice. The room was a little outdated - no dvd and no minibar. We wanted to go out for dinner. We were told upon checking in that we should bring the parking slip to the attendent in the parking facility in case we needed to take advantage of the in/out priviledge. She rejected the slip and we had to go back to the front desk to get the slip we in fact needed to get out of the parking facility and back in without paying double fee. Another line even longer than earlier had formed in the reception area and if we hadn't just jumped in front of everybody we would probably still be waiting in line. Yes, the room is clean. The bathroom is nice. The location is like all other airport hotels at LAX. But the service is really why we can't recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Too quick to demand parking fees”
Reviews.Author: steelytim
Reviews.Content: I arrived here for my last night of a journey by motorcycle from Chicago along route 66. The first words uttered to me by a member of staff was " 12 bucks to park your bike". Nice welcome and a rip off. The parking garage opposite allowed me to park for free, but on check out the hotel tried to charge me!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay....great room, terrific food and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: GolferAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to LAX, has very comfortable rooms and an excellent staff. I would recommend this hotel to any business or leisure traveler. A great choice if you want to be in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a few bucks more for a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Platitude
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few months ago in an old room and it was dirty and the bed was uncomfortable. Anyways, I got a renovated room this time, and it was one of the most comfortable hotel stays I've had. Very clean, high floor, beautiful TV, new bed, and clean bathroom. If you stay here, pay a few bucks more for a renovated room!!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal near LAX”
Reviews.Author: GoSeeCal
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here once or twice a year for the past 8 years or so. The location is convenient for LA, Santa Monica, and downtown. The price with the Entertainment Card is $65 on the weekendsl. My room on this last trip was a little tired, and the carpet needed cleaning. Otherwise, it was fine. It looks like the higher floors may have been renovated. The rooms in the past have usually been a little nicer. This hotel is nothing flashy, but I find it to be comfortable, convenient, and a good deal. You have to pay for internet and parking, though. :(

Reviews.Title: “Old dirty room. Unattentive staff”
Reviews.Author: syasay
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights. We arrived late at our first night, which is at 9:30pm. Staff greeted us appropriately at check in. We asked if the room has a fridge. Staff said our room does not have one and will put get us one...however, since no fridge available at the time, the reception said we had to wait for the first available fridge and they will let us know (bad...I thought, no fridge for Crowne Plaza). We advised the staff that we need the fridge since we have a baby and we need to keep the fresh milk in the fridge. During our stay the fridge was not available at all. We had too keep filling in the ice bucket to keep the baby's milk fresh. The room we stayed at had stained carpet throughout. The white bed linen were also stained. Furthermore, staff did not explain that we need to fill in a hotel parking card, even though we indicated we have a car to park at the carpark. We ended up paying cash to pay for parking at the carpark exit booth, which work out cheaper if you only have to enter the carpark once ($11). Upon our check out, they wanted to charge our parking of $13.75 per night. Luckily we still keep our receipt. Not satisfied with dirty room, unreliable staff (failed promises - no fridge available for 3 nights??) and not explaining the parking system. We only stay here coz it's close to the airport. This stay had changed my view and expectation with Crowne Plaza, being an internationally well known hotel. This hotel should have a 2 star rating instead of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great Job - Attentive Staff, Location Quick and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CTtraveler52
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a meeting at this hotel and found the hotel be a great experience. Great job by the exceptional staff and excellent food and beverage team. The hotel has newly renovated rooms that are most comfortable and convenient for working within the room as the internet service was great. The complimentary shuttle service was on point and just a couple of minutes from LAX. Well done, keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel got it all right!”
Reviews.Author: HollyfromColumbus
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be the perfect spot when flying in and out of LA. The location couldn't be closer, and they have a free shuttle to the airport. The rooms were great - finally a hotel gives you comfortable work space if you don't only want to sit at the desk to work. They have several restaurants and great food. But the best part was the service - from the bell staff to the front desk to the housekeepers, everybody was no nice. I couldn't believe I was in LA! I was presenting at a conference there and it was the most prepared AV staff I have seen. It is always a hassle to get all of the various components of a presentation to work - sound, visual, set up - but again, this hotel has it down. It went off without a hitch! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, nice room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SanJose01
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy staying at this hotel, easy access from airport, got pick up within 5 minutes by the shuttle. Room is spacious and high speed internet is fast and easy to connect. Staff is very friendly and the food is great, especially the Sushi. Will definitely come back next time to LA airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Business travelers should avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tahoedenizen
Reviews.Content: I wish I had checked reviews before staying at this hotel -- my experience matches too many others. After a seven hour flight from Central America to LAX, I had to wait 40 minutes for the Crowne Plaza shuttle. The front desk wouldn't honor the rate I had reserved, and charged me the full rack rate (basically double), at 2am when I wasn't going to go elsewhere. I tried the shower -- and waited and waited for hot water. I was happy to get out of this place at 9am for my next flight. I won't ever stay here again. This hotel has a lot of local competitors -- you can do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, great food and the best nights sleep ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomd19
Reviews.Content: Had a three day meeting at the LA Crowne Plaza Hotel airport location. The entire staff was so friendly and nice and the beds were to die for!.. We ate most meals there and the chef had some items that crossed the world's epicure. When i got to my room the bed was so comforatable i forgot that I was at the airport. Took the shuttle both ways and saved a boat load of money. Cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Kesmith1
Reviews.Content: Just finished attending a meeting at this hotel. The meeting was a success in great part to the terrific service we received during our stay. New rooms,good food but most of all great attention to detail by all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: kim3385392
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend staying here. This is the worst hotel I ever stay in. The carpet was very dirty and stained. Stained on bedding sheets and bathroom towels. So GROSS!

Reviews.Title: “They charged us extra for almost everything.”
Reviews.Author: YupiYey
Reviews.Content: I'm going to be very punctual with this review. -The hotel charged us 25% because we needed a 2 bed room (which was requested when booked) -Extra internet cost (ridiculously high) -Extra cost for parking. -uncomfortable beds -Big bathroom with a small shower. This isn't a crowne plaza, it looks more alike a days inn or something similar.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: michigander311
Reviews.Content: I've been on the road for more than 10 years and I think it was a great place. Upgraded to the renovated room, spent five nights and it was perfect, spotless, quiet. Mattress was great, nice seating area good TV, Didn't even need the earplugs, etc. Restaurant was good, ate there three times, all meals were great. Shuttle service was fast and free. Front desk and concierge had their act together. Nice enough neighberhood that I felt safe in walking down the street.....traffic nearby, yes, but safe, yes. Only negative was that we had to park on upper levels of ramp, and getting out of there was kind of dfferent..

Reviews.Title: “Disturbingly filthy and outdated”
Reviews.Author: irishprincess70
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Ive traveled plenty for business and leisure and have not encountered such a disgrace. I chose Crown Plaza because it was on my comany's recommended list for hotels near LAX. Ill be sure it is removed ASAP. Not sure how they get away with the stained carpets, peeling wall paper, stained bedding, broken TVs and layers of dust. (see pictures) Im also unsure of the integrity of the good reviews on this site. My coworker and I booked 2 rooms at full price, direct on the website, not on priceline for $60 like many other unhappy guests who commented on TripAdvisor. Apparently there are some remodeled rooms that they offered to priceline customers for a higher fee according to some reviews. Even though I paid full price for my room I was not offered that option when I spoke to a manager about the condition of my room. I was offered free drink tickets and free breakfast but that doesnt make me any less freaked out about sleeping in filth. Out of desparation we ate in the restaurant of the hotel which was also poor. Our food was cold and tasteless. On top of that, they didnt even honor the drink coupon I had because it wasnt beer or wine that I ordered. (in fine print of course). It was too late in the evening to find another hotel and we were flying out early in the morning. I barely slept and stayed fully clothed until it was time to check out. It would have been tough to sleep with all the teenagers running up and down the hallways anyway. As I left my room at dawn, I saw the lovely room service tray of half eaten food in the hallway that had been sitting there when I checked in the day before...as old and crusty as it was when I arrived. A perfect ending for this nighmare of a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for One Night”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: We also won a Hotwire bid for the Crowne Plaza but weren't offered an upgraded room like others. We were tired and only there for a quick sleep but we did notice the very worn condition of the room (marks on the furniture, non-working lamp, etc.). The bed was acceptable but had pretty tacky decorations. The bathroom was huge as it was a wheelchair accessible room and the shower seemed to work fine. There is a restaurant and snack/coffee bar in the lobby. We arrived late so there were no dining options available and the nearest open restaurant was a fairly long walk. I quickly checked out the weight room and again it seemed acceptable but not great. There is a frequent shuttle to the airport shared with another nearby hotel. The hotel is adjacent to LAX but we weren't bothered by flight noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel that is close to LAX Airport.”
Reviews.Author: Markharveyslake
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, hotel. Very courteous staff. Rooms have nice layout.

Reviews.Title: “Big BLAH”
Reviews.Author: sushikick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and the entire experience was just BLAH. If anything, this hotel has motivated me to make more money, and never stay in another Crowne Plaza again. I gave it a 'BLAH' because it was the cheapest of the options furthest from Inglewood. The chair in the room was stained - obviously so, to a disturbing level. The TV didn't have the option for me buy movies, and when I called downstairs they didn't know how much the movies would cost (I wanted to weigh the PAID internet v. PAID movie option). I ended up buying the 12 dollar internet for 24 hours - and that was fast. The downstairs 'sushi bar' looked like it had fish in there from a couple months back. The gym had two very old (or worn) elliptical machines that made me feel like I was on an elliptical.. on a boat. I'm a fan of good value for your money. I just don't think this place tried to provide service anywhere near a standard that could help me place it in the category of anything "good". And, for the record - the two attendants at the desk work hard, but couldn't handle the crowds. I think they should put more feedback forms for the guests, because there really needs to be some major changes... and the new rooms won't really work if the attention to detail around the hotel isn't consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, all of the negative reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: johnhuhlee
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through PRICELINE and when I read all of the negative reviews, I was hoping they were isolated incidents. I'm a frequent traveler so I travel with an open mind knowing that bad reviews can be a coincidence rather than a trend. Unfortunately, the Crowne Plaza LAX seems to be a trend. Without a doubt, if you book your room through PRICELINE (or maybe even other companies as well), they will stick you in their "second rate" rooms. While my room wasn't as dirty as some of the other reviews, the furniture was really old, some of the wallpaper were peeling off, carpet was really dirty, and the most unacceptable of all, they had a really old TV.....so old that the picture was literally blurry. The staff was ok but for some reason, they had no more than 2 people working the front desk. At peak check in time, the line was extremely long. I'm sure they are understaffed do to the economy, but 2 people working the front desk at peak check in? A WARNING TO PRICELINE USERS: If you're booking a room in LAX, this hotel is gonna get chosen. There's obviously a reason for that. There's plenty of hotels around LAX. I think it's worth it to spend the additional $20-$30. I definitely expected more from a Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book 3.5* at LAX with Priceline! You will end up in this DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: rdmj1968
Reviews.Content: I stayed March 7th 2011 just for 1nt. I have to say a super 8 at a truckstop in the middle of Illinois was cleaner than this place. I cannot believe it is a Crowne Plaza...We checked in around midnight and there was a line??? Then we finally get checked in and go to the room.. OMG.. at the end of one of the beds on the crapet..(intentional) was a huge black stain...then the couch in the room had 3 very large black stains on it as well.. We called down and asked to moved again... Then on to the second room.... It was just slightly better.. by this time it was 2am we were exhausted and decided to just stay there as we had to be up in just a few hours.. Luckily the beds were comfortable and there were NO bed bugs as both rooms looked like prime candidates to have them.. we did do a thorough BB check. We got the room on Priceline for fifty-one dollars and I have to tell you I wouldn't stay there again if they paid me fifty-one dollars to do so. Also the bathroom was disgusting with stains on the shower curtain... that i noticed the next AM while in the shower..... They should have a sign on the front door (of the nice lobby-GO FIGURE) "Enter at your own RISK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Hard Beds, Dirty Carpets, Stains on Sheets!”
Reviews.Author: McfamilyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for the Crowne Plaza LAX through getaroom.com for $85/night. Some of the rooms at this hotel have been redone, but I think if you book a discount room through another site you are more likely to get one of the old rooms. We definitely got an old room. The carpet was stained and dirty! We had to wear our shoes in the room because the carpet felt so gross walking on it barefoot. There was what looked like blood stains on the sheets! Gross! There was a clump of hair in the bath tub. No way a maid did not see that unless they just didn't attempt to clean the bathtub at all. The beds were the hardest beds that we have ever slept on or more like layed on because none of us slept well because we were so uncomfortable! I was a little leiry of this hotel because of some of the reviews, but I thought at the time that maybe some of the bad reviews were from people more picky about their hotel rooms, but after staying there I think the bad reviews are spot on. We are not picky about the hotels we stay at. All we require is that the room is clean and the beds are reasonably comfortable. This room was far from that! I can honestly say that this was the worst hotel room we have ever had and we have stayed in many hotels. Even the $50 a night budget hotels that we have stayed in were way better than this hotel. The only reason we choose this hotel was because we like to park in the quikpark parking garage right next door when we fly. So we didn't have to go far to check in after parking. The Marriot down the street is a way better choice than this hotel. Only downfall there is no covered parking. But the rooms are clean and comfortable there. The only plus that this Crowne Plaza has is it's location and the free transportation to the airport. I DO NOT recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you stayed in a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Ariel11
Reviews.Content: My Priceline.com bid of $55/night got accidently accepted (I was not intending to stay near the airport, but somehow ended up there.). Despite its affordable price tag, I seriously reconsidered even pursuing our 3 day trip plan to LA after reading all the bad, depressing reviews and seeing the disgusting photos posted by other travelers. With a toddler and a clean-freak like myself in mind, it seemed like throwing away around $200 (because Priceline bid offers cannot be refunded) might be the only way to save our vacation from the worst hotel nightmare. Fortunately, I figured out from the Crowne Plaza Hotel website that there were renovated rooms at an extra cost. So we decided to upgrade our room as soon as we arrived (only additional $20/night). And boy, am I glad to have done that! With an exception of a bath tub (which has apparently not been replaced, but not too shabby either), everything was in brand new, sparklingly clean, and excellent condition. It definitely looked like a 4 star hotel room. Another thing that we liked is that they offer an option to gain internet access for 2 hours ($1.95), which was sufficient time to check emails and search for sightseeing/dining options for the next day. It would have been even greater if the internet was free, but I thought $1.95 was pretty reasonable. The only downside was the noise from the flights (relatively minor though) and from next room through a paper thin wall. Our neighbor was watching TV literally all night (from 1am to 6am), and that did bother our sleep on our first night of the stay. But since our neighbor left on the second day, that noise issue was no longer a problem. So all in all, we were happy with our stay. Important tips to the future travelers: 1) Try to play as much lowball bid as possible (I even saw someone got a room for $40/night) to get an overall decent deal. 2) For those of you who have higher expectation on hotel rooms, please do not hesitate to spend extra $20 per night to go with upgraded rooms. 3) Do not park in the garage which adds $14/night. There were always a few street parking spots in the back of the building (2 hour parking from 12am to 8am, which translates to a free parking from 10pm to 10am). 4) When you check in, ask for quieter rooms on the backside of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Californiadreaming64
Reviews.Content: We flew in on a red eye from the east coast. I had bid on and won this hotel through Priceline, but after reading the reviews, I was a little scared. As it turned out, there was no need to be. They provided a free shuttle that picked us up at LAX. We checked in at around 1am, which felt like 4am to us. We had requested adjoining rooms, but Priceline did warn us that there was no guarantee. There actually were none left, but the woman at the front desk found us two rooms next to each other, which was fine with us. We must have been in the newly renovated section, because we saw none of what was described by other reviews. The hallway and rooms had thick, plushy carpets. The room was very clean. The bed, pillows and linens were extremely comfortable. It was serriously one of the best night's sleep I've had in a hotel. Very quiet and comfortable. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning, which was very good. They also provided a free shuttle back to the airport so that we could rent a car. I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay and the staff is very professional”
Reviews.Author: HenryHonolulu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located to most places, and is very close to the airport. Easy access to and from the parking garage. The front desk staff is friendly and meets my needs when requested.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline should hang its' head in shame... Is not a 3.5 star hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Moonwillow1234
Reviews.Content: We named our own price on priceline and paid $75 for a room so that we wouldn't miss our early morning flight. I read the reviews of this hotel on my iphone the whole way from calimesa, ca to LA. My husband and I were so disappointed at hearing about the bad experiences people had that we almost booked a room somewhere else; but opted to save the money. We should have booked somewhere else. This hotel is a complete and total dump. It is old, filthy, and smells like raunchy stale cigarette smoke in our NON smoking room, and the headache inducing stench permeates every fiber of the room from the disgusting drapes to the worn, horrifically stained and dirty carpet, to include the DIRTY nasty duvet cover on the beds. We have two young children with us: 3 and 8 years old. They were coughing and crying tonight until they finally fell asleep. (I am writing this review from one of the two skanky double beds that come standard in their rooms.) The receptionists are incredibly rude and disrespectful. The Crowne Plaza parking is $12.00!!!! Ridiculous. The Internet is $10.00 per day. There is no complimentary breakfast. The room with two double beds is very small; no mini fridge. No frills. I suspect that the majority of this hotels' revenue comes from displaced passengers, flight crew, and the hapless victims of pricelines' very off base opinion of the star quality of this hotel. I will most definitely be writing to complain to any CP personnel that will listen. Huge disappointment for our last night in CA to be spent in a downtown equivalent of a motel 6. Please take note that the management of this establishment does not respond to any review of their hotel on tripadvisor. That's going to be a red flag for me from now on. Good establishments have management who cares and who go the extra mile to read and thoughtfully respond to peoples concerns.

Reviews.Title: “If you want sleep, don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Red_Admiral_R06
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March for 2 days business trip, the staff were very pleasent and helpful, I do not have any complaint on this front. What I do take issue with is the fact that it is SO close to the Airport I had almost no sleep in the room allocated, in fact on the second night, I moved the bedding into the bathroom just to distance myself from the airport noise. On looking at the soundproofing, the windows were the smallest air gap double glazing I have seen in years which explained the noise. The room was dated, not even a full list of TV cahnnels available, 30 as opposed to the usual 90 and no European channels such as BBC world service or Sky news, a bit disappointing. Facilities were otherwise adequate for a business hotel, but come on, having to pay for internet access at $10 a day, ridiculous especially as the room rates didn't even include a complimentary breakfast. Food was however good, a little pricey as were drinks but hey, this is LA so what do you expect. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? NO not if they wanted to be comfortable and get some shut eye

Reviews.Title: “Not at all like the pictures, except main entrance.”
Reviews.Author: npalmer1
Reviews.Content: The staff were rude when we tried to check in. The carpet was filthy, and probably should have checked for bed bugs. Not at all like any other Crowne Plaza I have stayed at before, our room was on the third floor and looked out onto the air conditioning vents or such. Was not worthy the money and won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, just awful”
Reviews.Author: cvikkim
Reviews.Content: I can't believe Crowne Plaza would possibly keep its name attached to this place. I've stayed in CP hotels before and have found them perfectly serviceable business-style hotels. This was completely awful. It was unbelievably dirty everywhere - hall carpets didn't look like they'd been cleaned in months, everything else was equally filthy (eg dirt in every drawer). The only benefit of this place is the location (which for us worked due to airport proximity but had nothing else to recommend it) but I would not stay there again, no matter how cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Comfort”
Reviews.Author: rmcgrain
Reviews.Content: One night in Los Angeles and all I wanted was a nice quiet night sleep, and, believe me, I got it at the Crowne Plaza on W. Century Blvd by LAX. Clean and comfortable are exactly the words that describe my overnight stay there. It was the best night sleep I had had in over a week. The next day, I was off to San Luis Obispo.

Reviews.Title: “The only word is disgusting”
Reviews.Author: gfroch
Reviews.Content: We got this room on Priceline for $40 and it was a rip-off. This hotel should be taken off line by Priceline. The room was filthy. I was shown another room, also filthy. The heater in the room only blew cold air. The fan in the bathroom was broken. After a shower the bathroom smelled of urine and smoke. It took an hour and several phone calls to get towels in the room. The business center had 4 computers and only one worked. The printer did not work. The staff was totally ineffective. I got into an elevator and pressed my floor number and the elevator went no where. Thank goodness the "open door" button worked. My son said it best... "it looks like someone gave birth over here." In addition to the carpet being uniformly filthy, as if it hadn't been vacuumed in months, there was a huge red spot near the window. In addition, they charge for internet, even in the "business center." No one charges for internet anymore! Our stay was like staying in a haunted house. It just kept getting worse. We could not wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Quick layover on long trip to hawaii”
Reviews.Author: berrysink
Reviews.Content: We live on the east coast and wanted to layover in LA on way to Hawaii. This hotel fits the bill. Booked on Priceline for $60. Very reasonable price. Quick shuttle to and from airport. Room was decent size and the bed and pillows were extrememly confortable. Hotel is very quiet and got a great nites sleep. They are renovating the rooms but we got the older room which was ok. Only complaint was the lack of restaurants and quickmarts. There is a coffee shop and restaurant by the lobby that serves sandwiches and coffee. ON the expensive side. Most of the clientelle seemed to be airline employees or for business. Talked to one airline person who said that she stays here all the time on layovers and are very happy with the accomidations. Take that for what it is worth, Would stay here again if the need arises.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: goodstuffisgoodstuff
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the same day I was going to check in and got a great price by naming my own price on Priceline. I could not have been happier. I checked it around midnight and the staff was friendly and helpful. My room on the 11th floor was HUGE, I got a standard king size room. Apparently it had been recently renovated and they did a good job, It had a nice LCD tv, a little lounge chair thing in the corner a big comfortable bed with like 8 pillows. It had a desk as well. There was a lot of room to just walk around. The air conditioner (controlled by in-wall thermostat) got super cold in a jiffy, but its okay because there were like 3 comforters. I do believe the carpet was kind of grimy but it was hard to tell because its a brown carpet so I may be mistaken. The bathroom was actually pretty nice sized. It included nice toiletries like shampoo, facial bar, soap, etc. The shower got hot in a second and had good flow.
