Also, if you forget bathroom essentials like a toothbrush, comb, razor, etc. they'll provide them complimentary which is nice. One downside is the internet is expensive, $10.95 for 24 hours, $4.95 for 4 hours or $1.95 for 2 hours although I don't know why the 4 hours costs MORE? Why not just do the 2 hours twice which equals $3.90? The dining choices are expensive, they have some in-room dining as well as some restaurant, coffee stand and a little sushi stand. I recommend walking the half mile straight shot to Carl's Jr. If you want some inexpensive fast food. Besides other local hotel restaurants, that's pretty much the only dining establishment within walking distance. If you walk a couple hotels down to the Marriott, they have a Starbucks with free WiFi, they also have a FedEx Office location in case that comes in handy. Back to the Crowne Plaza, they have a pool, fitness center and Sauna, all of which are free to access with your stay which is pretty cool. It is right near the airport so you can hear planes taking off and landing but it wasn't overbearing. If it is, the room has a bag that comes with earplugs. Overall a great experience for an overnight stay near LAX. They offer late check-out (2pm) for free and have a 24 hour shuttle which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere else....no matter how cheap the rate is....”
Reviews.Author: bethmcshane
Reviews.Content: They call it a "sweet dreams" gift bag, and it's dispayed proudly on the bed when you enter the room: Lavender pillow spray, eye shades and earplugs. It's managements artful way of saying "Yeah, this place is a noisy dive, deal with it!" This place is tired, underloved, loud, smelly....you name it. It should be downgraded on priceline and hotwire....it is NOT a 3.5 star establisment!!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty. I can't believe they let it get this bad.”
Reviews.Author: pmschneidau
Reviews.Content: I stay in about 150 hotels a year and this one had just about the filthiest rooms I've ever seen. There just aren't enough places to put your stuff so that nothing touches the floor. And the stains and smells in the room made us wonder what else was in there, so it was difficult to cozy up and get a good night's sleep. Alas, it was just too late at night with an early departure to change hotels. The staff at check-in and check-out was very pleasant and service was quick, though. Renovate those rooms and this will probably be a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “never been so badly treated, their client attention stinks!”
Reviews.Author: pattyjudy
Reviews.Content: had a problem with my reservation, and there was no one to help me, they jusst kept looking at the computer while talking to me. so i complained with the manager, such a horrible person, instead of apologizing for how rude his personnal had been, he just said"we don't compensate our clients if they are mistreated". we never asked for a compensation, all we wanted was someone to traet us as clients who chose to pay that specifical hotel and were just wanting to be treated as we deserved! we travelled for 20 days all around california and nevada, not once were we so badly treated in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First and last visit”
Reviews.Author: goldtown
Reviews.Content: I make 4 overnight trips a year to Southern California and decided to try this hotel when I received a discounted rate. My mistake. The carpet was filthy, the window had probably never been cleaned, and the room was located next to the housekeeping station (or at least it sounded like that at midnight and 2am). The bed was actually pretty comfortable, so it was even more frustrating that I was woken up by the housekeeping staff in the middle of the night. This was my first and last viist - if this is how 'friends and family' are treated, I'd hate to see how a guest is treated.

Reviews.Title: “Location near LAX is this place's big virtue”
Reviews.Author: JustinW27
Reviews.Content: I am sure that other hotels in LA can offer a better LA experience. However, if you need a decently priced hotel near the airport ( technically in the airport boundary) this works. Got a good deal on room rates via Hotwire, so this ends up being a good deal, what with the free airport shuttle and a couple of food options in- house. There is not much in the immediate vicinity, so either you taxi to some other part of town or you make do with the hotel's restaurant selections. They do offer live music some nights which can be nice. One quibble...I really dislike hotels like this that charge for Internet access (throughout the hotel, even in the lobby). Bad joss.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Well Maintained Property, Great Service, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WearyBusinessTravele
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crown Plaza LAX nearly every week for the last 6 months. I keep coming back week after week because the service is outstanding for what I need. From the front desk, to the restraunt, to the Concierge Club, everyone works hard for a good experience. I fully recommend this hotel property to both pleasure and business travelers. The rates are better than most in the area, the location could not be better for LAX and area businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located but not recommended before renovation is over”
Reviews.Author: hazinheira
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza LAX in the beginning of January '11 for 3 nights. The hotel is conveniently located right next to LAX airport. This hotel is going through renovation and customers are only informed upon check-in. Breakfast was poor (only the fruit was tasty), the hotel doesn't serve early breakfasts (which is odd since it's an aiport hotel), rooms had poor insonorisation, club lounge was closed until mid-January, facilites are run down. Conclusion: don't stay for more than one night and wait for renovation to be concluded. After that, perhaps this hotel will meet Crowne Plaza standards...

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight.”
Reviews.Author: apdva
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night after a long over-red eye from the Pacific Islands and before a flight back to the east coast. I checked in early (i.e. before check in time) without any problems - and got put on the "quiet floor." The quiet floor was indeed quiet (never heard an airplane or anyone else, and the hotel was exactly what i needed. The hotel even provided eye masks. The restaurant was fine/good yet nothing spectacular and the bar and restaurant had good service. The hotel room itself (and I think I was in a non-refurbished room as it still had a non-flatscreen tv) was perfectly acceptable. Very clean (other than the outside windows ) and fully functional (other than a broken, leaking iron). I had spent the previous two nights in a Sofitel and Holiday Inn. To be honest, in my opinion, the bed was the least comfortable of the three, but that is a matter of personal preference... I actually got the hotel through priceline - and was thrilled at how well it turned out - especially after the negative reviews I had seen here. If you are looking for a clean, pleasant place to stay after a long flight, this is an excellent choice. Staff was also very pleasant and responsive. My biggest complaint occurred at the airport -- I did notice that the shuttle for the Hilton came more frequently. but that might have just been happenstance rather than a regular occurrence. On the whole, I think it is a lovely place to stay for an airport hotel!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL.”
Reviews.Author: jess140710
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a brief night (thank goodness). The only good thing is the shuttle service to LAX. Other than that, I would say that I would rather sleep in my car in the garage across the street than that disgusting room. Thankfully I only paid 65 dollars on it through Priceline. I still thank that was too much money.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Fifi58
Reviews.Content: Pro - it is extremely close to LAX and the airport noise was minimal. Cons - there are many. Lets start with the service. The front desk employees were ghastly. I was given a bill (under my door) two nights before checkout that was confusing and said that they needed more "authorization" from my credit card. When I went to the front desk to ask about the bill, the front desk clerk was snarly and told me that I was checking out that day. I told her that I was not and she got even more snarly. I asked her about the note that said that they needed more "authorization" and she said my credit card didn't have enough to cover my bill. I was a little taken aback by that and then the "manager" stepped in to confirm that. I told them that that was impossible and only then the first clerk admitted that she was looking at the wrong account. She did not apologize...I then got a little angry at this situation and wanted to know if I really needed to check out and find another hotel in an hour, as the first clerk told me that I was checking out that day and the hotel was sold out. The "manager" pointed to my bill which had the CORRECT CHECK OUT DATE and said that I was not and that I shouldn't freak out about it. I told him that the ONLY reason I was "freaking out" was because his employee told me that I had to leave and the hotel was sold out. Never an apology from either of them. The maids knocked on our door early in the morning two out of the 5 days, even with the do not disturb sign displayed. We got one extra bottle of shampoo in the time we were there. There was a horrible stain on the bed skirt that was extremely disgusting. Use your imagination. The queen size beds are not...they are doubles. The water never got hot...we took luke warm showers. The hallway to our room was freezing cold...there was an open vent at the end and it whistled at night. The restaurant was just okay but the wait staff was terrible. Some couldn't understand us, and I'm pretty sure we speak decent English. I've never had a hard omelette before...I didn't like it! The coffee shop which sold coffee, donuts, sandwiches, etc. was much better. All-in-all, not a good trip and the hotel is also under renovation. I'm not sure if our room had been renovated or not...hope not. It looked like it was in a time warp. Also, there was a missing picture from the wall and a huge black mark was in it's place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with nearby public transport to beaches”
Reviews.Author: scousemouse
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel, located on Century blvd, one of many on the Los Angeles Airport (LAX) site with a regular free shuttle service to the various terminals which means that the traveller does not have to rely on taxis. The rooms are of good size, comfortable, reasonably well equipped, have comfortable beds and a generous bathroom with ample towels and toiletries. Despite the proximity to the airport we found airplane noise was not a problem. Breakfast was very nice, if not a little pricey, with a good selection of cooked food, oatmeal, pancakes, fresh fruit, juices and teas. The main problem with this hotel, and the others on the LAX site, is the lack of alternatives for eating and drinking – and as a result of this, lack of competition which means prices are fairly high. With some searching, alternative bars and eating houses can be found which offer decent fare at reasonable prices – but they are not, at first, obvious. The local bus company runs regular services to Santa Monica and Venice Beaches from the nearby bus station at bargain 1$ fare and Manhattan beach and Manhattan Village Shopping Mall can be accessed in daytime via the trolley bus (5$ return ticket available in the hotels for this service) which stops near all the main hotels. We recommend that both types of transport are used, if you have a few hours to spare – spotting oceanfront locations made famous in various TV programmes and films.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed the room in this one.”
Reviews.Author: JohnyChevyEG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a morning flight and it was pretty cool. The rooms were clean and tidy. The soda machines on our floor gave us the wrong soda but I went down to the lobby and they helped me acquire the correct one. Shuttle was available to take us to the airport and they were quick and courteous. One downside is the restaurant was not serving the full menu so we didn't get a nice selection of food. I think it was like that for the holidays though.

Reviews.Title: “THEY ARE MY FAMILY AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: ClydeKadiddlehopper
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the LAX Crowne Plaza Hotel for 7 or 8 years, an average of about 2 nights a week. They truly are my family away from home, and all the customer contact people have become my friends - they truly do take care of the customer and make them feel like family. I love their new make over work!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Grampa Fred

Reviews.Title: “Good LAX airport reliable shuttle”
Reviews.Author: dougkuzo
Reviews.Content: Good room. No business center??? Computer use .25 per minute in the lobby. They make an affordable real brick oven pizza (Big 16" for $16) in the lobby take out. The pizza was a total surprise as it was wonderful. Shuttle was efficient. Overall slightly above average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for early morning flight; Otherwise, avoid until renovated.”
Reviews.Author: mjk8371
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on a $52 Priceline bid prior to an early morning flight out of LAX. That's the only acceptable reason for staying at this hotel, at least until the renovations that are just beginning are completed. We arrived around 8:30 pm and were told that the only remaining rooms were "Smoking" rooms. Were they ever! As soon as the elevator doors opened, the stench of stale cigarette smoke nearly overwhelmed us. My wife and kids would be writing a much harsher critique than I am here. The carpets were dirty, the room smelled and overall it's badly in need of renovation. But on the other hand, for a simple night's stay close to the airport at a decent rate, it will suffice. I slept well and the airport shuttle got us to the airport on time. HOT TIP: If you're staying here and wish to leave your car for an extended period, purchase parking for the Airport Center lot on cheapairportparking.org. We paid less than $6 a day for the same lot the hotel charges somewhere around $20/day. This deal far surpasses any "Park n Fly" deals offered by the Crowne Plaza as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is amazing....”
Reviews.Author: MariaHelena_USA
Reviews.Content: If you need a LAX hotel that is close to the airport. I'd definitely recommend Crowne Plaza LAX. This hotel is fantastic, lovely, the rooms are great, spacious and very comfortable. Restaurant for breakfast/dinner are really good. All this with a friendly staff and fantastic location. Way to go Crowne Plaza ! Congratulations ! Maria Helena Silva Phoenix/AZ

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, conveniently located, shuttle service, excellent food.”
Reviews.Author: Zoeann
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and were pleasantly surprised by the dining menu. Varied and excellent choices and very delicious. Room was very nice, comfortable bed. Some remodeling going on. Helpful staff. Would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but could be quieter”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel as a result of a bid of $57 ($72 total with taxes/fees) bid through Priceline. Ít is not quite at the level of the Sheraton Gateway and Hilton hotels nearby, but is more or less equivalent to the 3-star Radisson down the street, though at the Radisson we got free Internet (Crowne Plaza charges $10.95, whether in your room, business center or public areas, and I declined) and I heard a bit more airplane noise from the room at the Crowne Plaza (virtually every room faces the airport runways). The restaurant looked okay in terms of selections but, not surprisingly, lacked atmosphere, so we dined at the Encounter Restaurant in the middle of LAX. Hotel's location is fine. Concierge/ball captain desk personnel were helpful. I probably wouldn't hesitate to return, especially at the Priceline rate, except for the airplane noise (I did manage a decent night's sleep with ear plugs, and my wife was not bothered much).

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: StephMW10
Reviews.Content: How does this hotel get away with saying that it is three and a half stars? I've stayed in nicer two star motels. Everything is old and filthy. I was given a smoking room (my guess is because I paid through Hotwire). I asked if they had anything else but was told no, so I figured it wouldn't be too bad. Wrong. I could barely breathe. The room smelled worse than a Vegas Casino. I don't even think a smoker would stay in that room. I kept the window open all night (that's right, the window actually opened). It was so overwhelming and disgusting. The carpets and walls were dirty, the television picture was blurry and there was dirt in the sink and shower. I wouldn't even pay Hotwire's low rate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are beat up”
Reviews.Author: gaiuslives
Reviews.Content: GENERAL: The hotel is very convenient to LAX. It has a fine lobby/common area with a sit-down restaurant, a "grab and go" deli, a bar, and a gift shop. The bar offers live jazz music on Thursdays. Wi-fi internet is available in the lobby. If you stay in the lobby all night, you will be very happy. But for most travelers, we actually spend most of our time in the rooms, and that is where the problem lies, as follow... ACCOMODATIONS: The room I stayed in was BADLY in need of renovation. The wallpaper (beige) bore assorted scuff marks. The carpeting (again, beige) seem to have a thin seam of dust all along the edge of the room where the floor met the walls. An easy chair/ottoman combo was comfortable but seemed very dated. The bathroom (again, most beige) provided adequate counter space overall. The faucet in the sink was no longer firmly attached to the vanity, it moved a tad whenever I shut the water on/off. The caulk along the edge of the bathtub had "potholes", simply worn through from its age. The hotel is located on Century blvd near LAX. Airplane noise was not a problem, however, street noise was occasionally heard. Wi-fi in the room was about $10/24 hour period (that fee is waived for higher-level priority club members). My overall impression is that the hotel chain has woefully neglected the rooms in this hotel. If I had to guess, the room interiors seem to be 30 years old. Before checking in, thought the rate quoted ($125 for a AAA member) was an incredible deal. However, the poor quality of the room, brought me back to reality. I was very disappointed with the accomodations. Given its location to LAX, this property should be maintained as though it were the "flagship" of the chain in Los Angeles. Instead, its more like an aged aunt that no one in the family wishes to take to dinner. As of this writing, the hotel's website indicates the hotel will be undergoing renovation shortly. That renovation is LOOONNGG overdue.

Reviews.Title: “Stress free LAX parking”
Reviews.Author: SantaClaritaWinedog
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that my wife and I have availed ourselves of the Crowne Plaza's park and ride package. The hotel provides a spacious, comfortable room, and up to 7 days of parking at a reasonable price. The concierge level is worth every cent of the additional cost, giving you a room on that floor, and access to the concierge lounge, which provides a hosted beer and wine reception, from 5:30 to 7:30, with enough food to constitute dinner. At 6AM, the lounge provides a perfectly adequate continental breakfast. The lounge is masterfully hosted by Tony, who flawlessly sees to everyones needs. When getaway time comes, the efficient shuttle takes you right to the terminal, on a 24 hour basis. We have tried most every LAX parking venue, but nowadays, when we fly from there, Crowne Plaza is our first choice as an option that takes the stress out of air travel.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm, not the hotel for an extended stay of for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: DamianBelfast
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine if you're just staying there to be close to the airport. If you're there as a sightseer then stay downtown. I stayed here for 3 nights in total and I thought I was in a backwater town. There is nothing around there apart from a Burger King and a Dennys and a few 7-11 type stores, which are all quite a walk from the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable but nothing special. Not what I expected from Crowne Plaza at all. Saying that I did get a very good price through hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza LA has it all”
Reviews.Author: cleidesantos0
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Hotel staff and accomodations, easy access to airport and to the Manhattan Beach, cute lobby and adorable bar & restaurant in site, our room was spacious, unbelievable quite considering that we stayed at the airport area and for our surprise we found at our bed a welcome cute dog made of a towel. Thanks to Channa, our stay could not be any better then this.

Reviews.Title: “worn room which bit, chaotic check-in”
Reviews.Author: formerisan
Reviews.Content: We arrived around midnight for a Park and Fly. We were assigned a room which was occupied. The staff woke up the poor occupant to confirm that the room was occupied. The re-assigned room we stayed was very worn. My wife and I were both bitten during the night. The chain and the hotel were quick to reply to my complain but the experience was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: Sharonp1953
Reviews.Content: The rooms were okay, no complaints there, but I was told I had been upgraded (as a Platinum member of IC Hotels this is automatic if available) but I had not been upgraded at all. Later offered a discounted room rate to compensate. Advised to walk to car rental, even though I told them I was recovering from broken leg, at least one mile walking distance, although looks less (in a direct line). The staff were not at all efficient. I am still, nine days later still awaiting information about something lost/stolen from my car. Really poor response to this problem. I would only stay here if I had no other option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing nearby if you have to stay for a while”
Reviews.Author: ally0911
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel for an overnight stop but nothing else in the area

Reviews.Title: “What a complete hole!!!”
Reviews.Author: DnDAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night.got room 622. The beds were nice and neat but that was about it. The room looked like multiple frat parties had taken place in the room. I ended up wearing socks and shoes most the time as I did not want to step on the carpet. Outside of the lobby the entire place looked like it could do with a complete makeover. Between the dingy carpet and the nicks and drag marks on the wall The staff had attitudes and would rather you leave them alone than help. Save your money and stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Nice Location, noisy AC Unit”
Reviews.Author: figment7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and real close to LAX which was the prime reason we selected it. Once we got checked in at check in time (unable to check in early) made it up to the room and was provided ear plugs and some other items I thought was a nice touch. I thought the ear plugs were because of being close to the airport, however they must have known who my neighbors were going to be and my AC unit in the room. The family arrived at around midnight and proceeded to have family across the hall where they left their doors open to the room and just yelled back and forth about the plans for the next day. Once that stopped after about 2 hours or so then trying to go to sleep with the AC in the room was horrible. Every time the unit turned on it sounded like someone banging on your door, once it got going it was fine but everytime it would shut off and turn back on later it would wake any normal sleeper up and I am a pretty heavy sleeper. Hopefully its just a rare occurence with the rude neighbors! However, the hotel is in a great location for LAX even though walking to food locations is a little walk (about 3/4 a mile to BK, .5 to Subway, 1.3 to In N Out) etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: Novocastrian_Ash
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here to break up my travels between Australia and the US. After scoring a room on Priceline for US$45, I came in not expecting a lot. The free shuttle to/from the airport was great, and I believe it runs constantly. Check in was ok, though I was quite disappointed there were no offers of assistance with my luggage. The room was nothing special, and a little dated but it did it's job. I had a king sized bed which was amazing and there were plenty of tv channels to choose from. I do have concern regarding the thoroughness of the bathroom cleaning as there were wrappers on the ground under the sink at the back but the toilet and shower seemed clean enough. I had a room overlooking the airport which was great though there was obviously quite a lot of noise associated with this- but choosing an airport hotel you do expect it. The hotel also seems to be the choice for many of the airlines when staff stay over. Overall it was a reasonable experience, what one would expect from an airport hotel and if you are only needing somewhere to sleep for a few hours between flights then it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CherieL_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there with 2 friends. We flew in from Australia and were flying to Montana the next morning. It was important we had somewhere comfortable and quiet to relax after the long flight. This was perfect. They were doing the hotel up when we were there but that did not interfere with us at all. The rooms are spacious and spotless. The pool and spa were great. The bedding was awesome. Very comfortable and relaxing. The staff were great, couldn't do enough for us. The hotel had a shuttle to/from the airport which we needed. The hotel is a bit of a walk to any shops but not an impossible walk as we did it. There is a Denny's a couple of blocks away with pretty good food.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you can get a good rate...”
Reviews.Author: foofighter1981
Reviews.Content: Wound up getting this place for a second time via Priceline... good experience for the most part, and definitely a no-brainer if you have an early flight out of LAX. Couple bummers-- parking is extra ($13 a day, includes in/out privileges), internet is extra, food is pretty expensive and not that great. Guess we should be grateful there's no resort fee (yet), which seems to be the new trend with hotels nickel-and-diming us. There's quite a bit of plane noise, which could be a deal-breaker for light sleepers. If you're visiting LA as a tourist and price is your primary concern, this hotel is definitely worth considering if you can find a rate well below $100. Otherwise, there are plenty of competitive options along the 405 in West LA.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Location.”
Reviews.Author: SFWorld
Reviews.Content: With a need to catch an AM flight out of LAX the last thing I wanted was to deal with LA trarffic. My decision was to find an airport hotel and this one is a good choice. The hotel is nice (enough), they have a free shuttle that runs regularly, and the price is reasonable versus having stayed in Santa Monica and dealt with traffic in the morning. When I had an issue it was quickly addressed and that truly is the key to good service- everyone makes mistakes. I needed a good night's sleep and I got one. I did not have to plan to get to the airport on time- the shuttle ran every 20 minutes and took less than that to get me to my terminal. If you keep in mind this is an airport hotel then you should not be disappointed. It does the one thing it needs to do well: gives you a decent room that is close to the airport at a reasonable price. Lack of free high speed internet was one downside but for the price I could have paid the $14.95 and still come out ahead. I chose not to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel looking shabby”
Reviews.Author: baglan
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to hotel - short shuttle ride from LAX. I have stayed at this hotel previously but it's looking a bit run-down now. Beds are comfortable and rooms a reasonable size. I wa stroubled by some late night aircraft noise but that may be more due to my jet-lagged state, using the room a sconvenient start point after arrival in LA from London. Buffet breakfast is OK but hot food of limited choice and not too hot - I would have preferred a meal cooked to order but it was not offered. Concierge floor is good with free drinks and snacks and WiFi internet included - a good value deal. Rental car locations only a short walk from the hotel therefore ideal for morning pick up. I booked with Hertz which is the furthest away - approx 15 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Apparently much better if you're a PC member”
Reviews.Author: bilz
Reviews.Content: I stay here from time to time on business and I've noticed most of the bad reviews come from priceline customers. If you book through priority club (use the entertainment card for a good rate), you're on one of the top floors with free high speed internet. Parts of it do look a bit dated, and it doesn't compare to $200/night hotels, but for the price and location, it can't be topped. My only complaint about the hotel is that the parking garage is old, ugly, and since 90% of the spots are labeled as compact, it can be hard to find a spot at times since everyone is forced to doublepark and take two spots. I have a compact car and even that fits between the lines with only an inch or two to spare, which means you can't open your door if someone is parked next to you. There's another lot not associated with the hotel across the street, which might be a better option..

Reviews.Title: “Oh my what wonderful beds”
Reviews.Author: ita360
Reviews.Content: The bad: pay internet access really? The good: location to LAX, shuttle (every 20 min), clean nice rooms, the most comfy beds EVER! Made it really difficult to get out of bed. 24 hr staff. Bakery/coffee shop at hotel. (great to stop at while waiting for the airport shuttle).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location next to LAX”
Reviews.Author: DrKatieRN
Reviews.Content: Visited family near LAX. Hotel was very convenient. Rooms were standard, but very comfortable. The beds was great. There were little in amenities (shampoo and coffee). Breakfast was not included. There is a free airport shuttle. I would stay there again on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: lizfonti
Reviews.Content: Paid $74 per night and stayed here on recommendation of a friend and she was right. It's only 10 mins to explore the beaches and so much cheaper than the city or beach location hotels. Our room and bathroom was immaculate and although we overlooked the road the sound proofing was excellent even though ear plugs were supplied they were not needed. The other thing supplied was a linen spray which was strange but so handy as we had been travelling around California for 10 days and our cases were a bit wiffy. The beds were amazingly comfortable, one of the best sleeps I've had in a hotel for a long time. Took advantage of the laundry room which was very reasonable at $1.50 to wash and $1.50 to dry a huge load. Staff/service was generally very good as was the cleanliness of the public areas. Free fitness centre which my son took advantage of, basic but perfectly adequate especially as we had been paying to use this facility at the other hotels we'd been staying at. My only gripe was the breakfast buffet which was quite poor in quality and choice. The second day we decided to order from the menu but almost gave up the will to live waiting for it to arrive but it finally did after the third request. It would also be nice to have a pot of tea and a decent choice of black teas rather than a cup of hot water which goes cold very quickly. Although the cup of hot water does seem to be the norm in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Best Business hotel close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: cjosephi
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel whenever in LA for 25 years . The people are great from Mike payton the GM to Denise Lowe my Sales Person to Tony who works in the 16th floor Priority Club . The price is right , great restaraunt and bar ( jazz on Thursday nites ) and only minutes from LAX by shuttle . Excellent for the price !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price”
Reviews.Author: micanthony76
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here to pick up my husband from the airport and look around LA again. Everyone here was wonderful and asked if I needed anything when they saw me, The beds were extremely comfortable and soft. The hotel laid out a little bedtime bag on the bed, which inlcuded earplugs that I did not need. We spent the next day in Venice which is a very close driving distance. I would rather stay here and drive to Venice than pay the Venice hotel costs. They have something for everyone; a pool, hot tub, valet service, self parking for a fee, a gym, and restaurants. The rooms and bathrooms are both nice sizes and the 3 of us were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RATE WITH ENTERTAINMENT CARD/COMFORTABLE/HELPFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: AFamilyGuy_1
Reviews.Content: This CROWNE PLAZA property I found to be MOST COMFORTABLE as the beds were GREAT & the room amenities were plentiful. The property has 6 elevators & it was only a matter of seconds did I have to wait for one when needed. The pool is small but CLEAN & on a 3rd floor deck area along with a HOT spa! The parking is next to the hotel & does require a daily fee of $12 which has just been raised to $13.75 as of this review but was easily accessable to in/out's but I do feel the fee could be HALF for guests. If you use the ENTERTAINMENT card you do get a GREAT rate thru the CROWNE PLAZA HOTELS web site. This property was MOST pleasing & BETTER than some of it's previous reviewers have given it. I'd definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One nighter only.”
Reviews.Author: GeordieViking43
Reviews.Content: Typical big city traveler's hotel. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Decent sized room with an excellent bathroom. Food selection from the deli bar in the evening was very poor but surprisingly the breakfast buffet was excellent. The main attraction of this hotel is that it's close to LAX and to the car hire companies. One good point was that we didn't notice any noise from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good rate, it's good deal”
Reviews.Author: GoSeeCal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for 2 nights (Fri/Sat) in May. We got a $59 rate with our Entertainment Card. We though it was a good deal. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It has been probably ablut 5 year since the rooms were updated, and it could use another update, but it's still in pretty good shape. The beds were very comfortable. The two drawbacks are: 1) you have to pay for internet service and 2) you have to pay for parking, which is in a parking structure that is not attached from the hotel (so it's a bit of a hassle to come and go from the hotel). Still, if you get a good rate, these are minor quibbles. The location is near LAX. It's great if your travel involves the airport. Otherwise, it's a bit remote from most stuff in LA that you might want to do. But if you stay on a weekend and have another person in your car (which gets you into the HOV lanes), you can get downtown pretty quickly--about 15 minutes. Traffic into and out of downtown was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Fine - not as bad as the reviews say!”
Reviews.Author: wafam66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this room through Priceline and got a great deal. After reading the reviews, I was extremely nervous that we'd be staying in a dump for a few days! It was fine. The staff at the front desk were helpful and the room was clean - nothing special, but we were just there to sleep and shower, and it served that purpose just fine. I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend paying the going rate, but would certainly recommend if they got a good deal on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Tired old rooms and rude employees”
Reviews.Author: sbs1
Reviews.Content: Not up to Crowne Plaza standards, if you normally stay at Crowne Plaza and know what they are normally like well you will be disapointed in this old and tired hotel. Its more like a Motel 6 hiding behind the crowne plaza brand. Front desk employees not very helpful and basically rude. The rooms were old and need a good clean, one bonus is the window opens all the way so you can at least get fresh air. One good and the only good thing about this hotel is the Internet at $1.95 for 2hours its a good bargain.. The room service food was good, Still hot when it got to my room and tasted great, Its very handy for LAX if you need a shuttle in the morning. So if your desperate for a hotel pick this one, but only if your desperate the Sheraton and Radisson looks much better

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: poppyredScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as an overnight stay before catching our morning flight, rooms were not clean and very outdated through out the hotel, did not have the rooms available that we booked and was offered an alternative on the smoking floor, which was unacceptable when you have children but did nothing to rectify their booking error. would not use or recommend this hotel to anyone. very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel for stopovers.”
Reviews.Author: floralsydney
Reviews.Content: Not expecting too much from an airport hotel, we booked the Crown Plaza for an overnight stay enroute from Australia to Ft Lauderdale. We were extremely tired and so we were pleasantly surprised with the quiet & and spacious room we were allocated.. A large comfortable king bed with soft pillows and block out curtains ensured a good nights sleep, and the large bathroom with decent sized vanity and shower with supersized showerhead was a bonus. We ate at the restaurant downstairs which had a variety of excellent food at reasonable prices and there was a pleasant bar/lounge area with live music. We could have happily stayed a few more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Much better alternatives in close proximity”
Reviews.Author: samsdadOrlando_FL
Reviews.Content: Won(?) with Priceline bid. Asked for 2 doubles given Handicapped King. Dirty matted carpet, iron burns on rug included. Thread bare towels, extremely noisy neighbor in the middle of the night. Some airport runway noise. OK bed. Good shuttle service. Stay away if paying regular rates!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: chaffs
Reviews.Content: Good airport hotel, Internet, parking at an extra price, free airport shuttle, along way from downtown, a bus and a train ride away. Limited choice of eateries nearby. Downside, surly member of staff on arrival who couldn't find our reservation and couldn't be asked to help.

Reviews.Title: “Place needs a huge renovation”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: When I first got to the hotel, I was impressed with the lobby. Nice tile floors, a couple restuarants, just a big city feel to the place. However, when I got to the rooms, well, what a dump. Carpet was stained all over the place, beat up bathrooms, stained walls, antiquated TV and loud AC unit. I travel extensively for business and this was arguably the worst room I have stayed in. The only bright side of the room was the bed, which was comfortable. I can't believe Crowne Plaza would let their rooms this bad. Especially in a high profile city like LA. If it was not for the lobby, I'd give it one star. I did get it for $50 a night on priceline. Not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: euscarol
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby area is nice when you walk in and check in. They have a nice coffee bar and small sushi area in lobby area. When you go up to your rooms the carpet is old. In my room the carpet is old and faded. Hallways and room smell a little musty. The wall paper has stains on it. My room was noisy so I asked for another room. I was told all the rooms are noisy because it is by an airport. They had housekeeping deliver some ear plugs. The chair at the desk is old and wobbles. The air/heat unit is one of those old ones that is on the side of the wall...kind of noisy. The pools is closed for renovation and not due to open until July 1. The fitness offering is a gym next door for a $10 fee. Parking is $20 for valet or $12.50 next door in a multi-story lot. I won't be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: mochaberry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Crown Plaza on February for personal trip. the service was great and people were friendly. there was alot of thinkg near by. also they were couple of food truck for lunch. for the value, everything is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Run or Fight”
Reviews.Author: jetski4fun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel as it was close to the airport. When my company made reservations we found the area to be booked solid. So the only place availible was the Crown Plaza. I typically dont stay at this chain but i figured how bad could it be. Wow was I suprised. When I checked in I didnt find anything strange. Got the room key for the 6th floor went up the elevator stepped off and it hit me CIGARETT SMOKE! This wasnt like someone walked by and you got a faint whif this was more like a pool room on a Friday night. I went to the room and opened the door and the smell was worse. I have on my profile no smoking so i thought this was an honest mistake so I called down to the front desk. Best they could do send house keeping up with a spay , a smoke killing device and open a window.. After they sprayed the now flowery cigarett smell was making me ill. I called back done and they confirmed there were no other rooms. I was not happy so i called guest services and complained theat the room was filithy someones hair left on the desk dirty fuzz balls on the ceiling and the rug had large stains and in the corners the dirt on the carpet from not being vaccume was disusting.Oh did i mention the cigarett burns on the rug and the bathroom sink. I finally asked to have the manager come up and and they magically found a room on the 16th floor that was nice. Seems sad you need to go thru this after working all day but this was business as useual for this hotel. So in the end they tried to make it right but it was a fight. Also if you need to print your boarding pass this classless hotel wants your to creditcard. I would not recommend this hotel staying in 3-4 hotel chains a month this was bad!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for LAX stopovers”
Reviews.Author: cpagia
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice on arriving and leaving from LAX, booking via priceline to get very cheap rates. The hotel shuttle is pretty common for hotels here, but good to have nontheless. Rooms and beds are as you would expect, comfortable and clean and the restaurant area does a good wood-fired pizza. Lack of free internet is annoying, although 2 hours in room (wired, no wifi) is only $1.95 If you're here for a couple of days and like the beach or shopping there is a trolley which takes you on a round trip for $3 and can happily fill in a day. There is also plenty of cheap car hire around if you want to drive further afeild.

Reviews.Title: “stains everywhere”
Reviews.Author: aaflyerincali
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of major cleaning. The hallways were stained, there were countless stains on the carpet in the room, the chair was stained. Walls were marked up, etc. The service was fine, but the room didn't feel clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Dabu35805
Reviews.Content: I bid this hotel from priceline. I read all reviews about this hotel before my trip. Be honest, it made me pretty upset. Well, it turns out not bad. The front desk is slow but the staffs are friendly. Parking and internet are not free. Neither does Marriott or Hilton. Room is clean. I have to admit, furniture is a bit old, but it is clean and tolerable. Aircraft noise is not an issue to us; maybe because our room faces the street. The hotel does provide ear plugs. Hotel didn’t provide tooth paste and brush. Called them around 9pm but no one answered phone. Had to call them again at Morning and got tooth paste and brush pretty quick.

Reviews.Title: “very average and non too friendly!”
Reviews.Author: WalesElizabeth
Reviews.Content: the rooms and corridors could do with a makeover. I found the reception and waiting staff tired and tetchy which suggests they could do with a greater level of appreciation and training from their employers? I wouldn't go back and I certainly wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: CatherineSNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here between flights. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. A gift pouch with items for the plane was on the bed. The shuttle was convenient. The breakfast buffet was good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: TaniaJ
Reviews.Content: For the first time ever I made my hotel reservation through hotwire and did not know what hotel I was getting until after the purchase occurred. I needed a hotel in the LAX area for a weekend conference. There were 3 possibilities that matched the offer for 3 ½ stars for $59 a night and after researching online reviews I was really hoping I would not get the Crowne Plaza for my reservation, but I did. I dreaded my stay and pre-requested a quiet, clean room with a king bed. Upon my arrival, I was surprised to find the staff to be friendly and helpful and my requests noted in my reservation were granted. They gave me a room in the “quiet zone” with a king bed and a small pull out sofa. The carpet was stained, the outside of the windows were muddy and the tv & furniture was outdated as mentioned in other online reviews, however the room was QUIET and the bed was definitely comfortable. The room was clean other than the carpet and the daily cleaning service was efficient. I personally would not take a bath in the small tub, but the shower had a massaging head and the curtain was curved out a bit as to make it less confining. I parked in the self parking lot (a reasonable $12 a day or something like that) and was able to walk to my conference at the Hilton in 15 minutes each way. The breakfast buffet was a good deal with the 50% off coupon given to me at check-in and seemed to be a popular choice. The outdoor pool was the smallest pool I have ever seen and the chairs did not have cushions on them but the sun was shining down on the woman taking advantage of the facilities where-as the rest of the area was still overcast. I did not use the pool, hot tub, fitness room, sauna or steam room but it was nice to know they were there just in case. I did try to get a drink from the drink machine that only takes credit cards. After the machine on my floor did not work, I went to the next floor. It took my credit card but did not give me a drink (twice). There is a number to call and get a refund but I have not called. I did get a drink coupon from the lobby when I reported my issue. There is a convenient trolley that loops from the LAX hotel area to Manhattan Beach regularly for $5 round trip. Buy the tickets at the front desk and enjoy. I felt safe and relatively comfortable during my stay and they allowed me to have a late check out. I would rate this hotel at 3 ½ stars max because it really needs an update in furniture, carpet and pool. I would recommend this hotel as long as you are not looking for a 5 star glamorous resort-type get-away.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised. Great service, great breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: MamaOpe
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on here and other sites I was very worried, about our stay. I got the hotel through priceline and did not know what hotel it was until I booked. It was considered a 3.5 star hotel. We reserved a room with 2 double beds and a crib, since we were traveling with our 6 and 2 year old. When we got there they only had King rooms. I was disappointed until they showed us the room equipped with a king bed, rollaway bed and a crib. It was a real crib (white metal) not a pack-n-play. It actually worked out better since the rollaway was closer to the floor and a twin size bed. I will probably ask for this set up on future hotel stays. The room was old, but very clean, and the beds were very comfortable. The tv was old, but that did not bother me. The rooms were cleaned very promptly (like by the time we got back from breakfast). The staff were very pleasant and accommodating. I would definitely stay there again, for the priceline/hotwire etc. reduced price.

Reviews.Title: “The Dirtiest 3.5 Stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcweb
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel in April. Checkin was smooth. Priceline wasn't mentioned. The staff was very friendly. The lobby looked great. We were assigned a room on the 5th floor. The carpet on the hallway looked old but it was ok. But the room was the dirtiest room we have ever seen. Stains were everywhere. I don't know how it was rated as "3.5 stars". Parking was $12 per day which I think is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A very tired hotel....”
Reviews.Author: SWEnglandTravellers
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Crowne Plaza LAX following a flight delay to the UK. We stayed for 3 nights and this was relatively unpleasant. The hotel is unlike other Crowne Plaza's we have stayed in previously and appears to have been forgotten about. It is in serious need of modernisation and refurbishment in the communal areas and the rooms. Our really low points were as follows; Our room was dull with old looking furniture. The windows were dirty and one did not shut properly which caused noise difficulties from the nearby runway & flight path. The ancient aircon unit rattled and the pipes vibrated through the wall to the next room (even if ours was switched off!). This noise was 24/7. Whenever the room above us ran their sink water or shower we found water coming into our bathroom sink and bubbling up in the sink pipes. The walls to the rooms were thin and we could hear people in the rooms either side talking. The outer bedding did not look particularly clean and the beds were not so comfortable. The restaurant is relatively dark with just a few windows that look onto a smoking courtyard. Again, the furniture and decor is tired and does not appear inviting. Our second visit to the restaurant was a real turning point due to the delivery of some bread and butter to our table by a waiter, which was accompanied by a long thick black hair woven through the butter scoops. This was utterly disgusting and we were in disbelief that not only had it been placed there by whoever prepared it but that it had also gone un-noticed by the waiter. It was clearly obvious and we immediately questioned the overall restaurant hygiene. We pointed this out and cancelled our food order, although the staff did not seem that suprised. Needless to say we did not eat here again. Good points; Either side of the hotel are the Sheraton and the Marriot. They are both very nice with relaxed yet smart restaurants. We spent a fair proportion of our spare time at the Marriot which has a nice lounge with free wi-fi (rare in LA), a Starbucks and great menus and service at the two restaurants. Breakfast here is certainly recommended also.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain for airport layover”
Reviews.Author: eddotcom
Reviews.Content: While we might not feel so favorably disposed toward the hotel had we booked it at the hotel web's rate, for the amount we paid on a priceline bid, it we would call it a great value. Pluses: · Room size. Our standard room was approximately 240 square feet, including the bathroom. · Beds and bedding. The beds were comfortable, of medium firmness, with a fitted bottom sheet and a top sheet which was not tucked in (eliminating the need to remake the bed when the bedding is pulled from beneath the mattress). It had both a blanket and a thin comforter, giving the choice of a light or heavier cover. · Black-out curtains which worked. A clip for the gap between the curtains was provided--a nice touch. In case the very small amount of light coming from the bottom of the curtain is troublesome, they provided a courtesy kit which included an eye mask. · Location. If you want an airport hotel, this is very close to LAX, with a courtesy van picking lodgers up from the airport about every 20 minutes. The "ocean blue" vans are easily spotted from any of the terminals. Minuses · The room air conditioner is similar to the old below-the-window units, complete with the perpetual drone of the fan. The courtesy kit with the eye mask also contained ear plugs. · The tube television is housed in a huge armoire, making the room feel smaller than it is. · The cultured marble bathroom counter (complete with cigarette burns) revealed the age of the hotel. But the bath is of ample size with all necessary amenities, including a night light, and quite adequate shower pressure. Tips · If you have a couple of hours to kill, a trolly/bus stops right in front of the hotel and goes on a loop to Manhattan Beach and a couple of shopping centers. The ride has an excellent recorded narrative describing points of interest along the route. Round trip tickets were just $3/person. · If you have more time, you can take the courtesy bus back to the airport and catch a free shuttle to the closest Metro stop. A day pass on Metro is $5, giving you access to all of LA. If you have the time and inclination, the Walt Disney Concert Hall a short walk from a Metro stop, where you may take a free audio tour of the facility. You can visit LA City Hall and enjoy a panoramic view of the city from the top floor, also free, or visit the nicely restored Union Station. The Metro even stops near Hollywood & Vine and other Hollywood locations.

Reviews.Title: “Improved Experience - Great for LA Overnighter (combines two reviews)”
Reviews.Author: mike110742
Reviews.Content: March 2010 Improved Experience, Excellent Choice for LAX Overnighter Because TA will allow only one review per hotel, this is a combo of two visits. I’ve criticized this hotel in previous review (below), based on an abundance of small, customer-unfriendly irritants and finding a room not ready (once). (See below for an earlier review and a message to third-party guests. Usually, I get rooms in this hotel via Priceline, and although it’s rated as 3.5 star, bidding for a 3-star will often return Crowne Plaza. Bid $50 or less.) Some of the caveats remain, but some things have improved: NOTABLE: (I am now known by name, and am on a list of some kind at the hotel, so this may get me a level of treatment not given to all guests.) Checkin was swift and easy. I was placed on the 15th floor, reserved for CP “priority” guests, and given a room with a nameplate that identified it as a suite. It was different from other rooms in attractive but cosmetic ways: faux marble entry and bathroom floor; a lovely quiet-flush toilet, an attractive ice bucket and new furniture fixtures, a soft ceiling light next to the bed, and a bottle of water. An airport shuttle runs about every 20 minutes. Nearby competitors (Courtyard, Radisson) offer free wireless, so the $11 charge is an irritant, but the option to buy 2 hours @ $2 works and download speeds are nothing short of remarkable--500 KB/sec, twice what I get at home. Free wireless that doesn’t work, common in hotels, is a big marketing mistake. BE WARNED: The shuttle is not announced inside the hotel lobby--you need to be outside. The stops are brief and you can fail to get a seat the shuttle because it is too crowded. (It’s run by a vendor, and also stops at Radisson.) Plan this possible delay into your trip. Another guest told me she missed two prior shuttles, and when she asked a bell desk employee, he was dismissive. In her words: Thirty seconds is not enough for me to get my luggage and myself outside. Announcing the shuttle’s arrival INSIDE the lobby is a small step that would help some slower-moving or hard-of-hearing guests a lot. A coupon given at check in for 50% off food and beverage used to help small eaters, but now applies to buffet only. The price of the buffet is high to begin with, so this is a big bonus for big eaters. Room doors still slam--hard. This is addressed by asking guests for quiet on the door tag, which clearly does not work. A fix would probably involve installing hardware closures, a big job. The hotel web site notes free local-area-shopping transportation but an inquiry to the concierge produced a referral to a taxi. The bus transit center is on 96th, a 1/4 mile walk. Know in advance the route you’re looking for, and have exact change for the fare. January 2010 Exceptional Bedding, Many Customer-Unfriendly Irritations [This note to Priceline & other third-party guests precedes all my reviews of hotels I purchased through a 3rd party vendor] 3rd-party customers read reviews and arrive with expectations; high attentiveness to guest needs distinguishes one 2-3-4 star from others. Third-party prices fill rooms, and provide the business with opportunities to sell services and win future customers. My advice: pay attention to reviews, articulate needs clearly (both in advance and on arrival) and speak directly and immediately to management if your expectations are not met. If basic room needs are unmet, ask management for adjustment; if unresponsive, tell the 3rd-party vendor in writing; use snail mail to the company’s street address and direct to Customer Service VP. I’ve found them responsive. Talk to management directly and pleasantly: they value meaningful guest feedback and often can use information you provide to correct persistent problems. Whatever rate you paid, be courteous and civil to a fault: it never helps to be confrontational. Commend with care what is commendable.] At almost any time of year, rooms can be had for LAX-friendly overnights at $40-50 on Priceline. If you are bidding on higher-star hotels, you may be rejected under $95. Don’t fail to adjust your bid DOWN if you drop star levels from 4 to 3.5. CP is treated as 3.5, but it can nearly always be had for under $50 on Priceline, and if you are bidding on 3-stars you may get it (3.5) instead, described by Priceline as an “upgrade.” COMMENDABLE: Guest laundry, regular free airport shuttle, very nice bedding. Expensive but well-operating wireless internet, with 2-hour-at-$1.95, 4-hour at $4.95 (What??) and 24 hours at 10.95. Simple but good curtain closures. Reasonable heat and cool controls.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping needs to inform front desk.”
Reviews.Author: JohnronNyc
Reviews.Content: I usually don't put much faith in negative reviews posted here. They either complain about ridiculous things (a review of a room being too wide comes to mind) or the hotel is described as being so bad I can't see how it is in business. I should have paid more attention. I had a two day layover on my way to Fiji. I wanted a hotel at the airport since I didn't want to deal with the infamous L.A. traffic and the airport has a shuttle to Disneyland. This Crowne Plaza fit the bill. With airport hotels, one shouldn't expect a luxurious resort. They are there for people who wanted a clean room and a comfortable bed for a night or two. So I could live with outdated decor and worn carpets and wallpaper in the halls. What I couldn't stand for a second was the room we were given upon arrival. As soon as the door was opened the odor of cat urine hit us like a linebacker. How the front desk didn't know about the condition of this room is a mystery. If housekeeping didn't have the equipment or materials to deal with this is one thing, but not to tell the front desk and keep them from giving out this litterbox of a room is inexcusable. Another problem with housekeeping is that while our room was well cleaned and made up both days, trays left in hall on our way out in the morning were still there upon our return in the evening. It wasn't all bad, the front desk staff were friendly and informative. And the restaurant serves a good breakfast . But until I read here that housekeeping has their act together, I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but not that bad.”
Reviews.Author: travellerdnc0910
Reviews.Content: I was SO worried after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and seeing some traveller photos. But when we got to the room I heaved a sigh of relief. The hotel was certainly old and has renovation plans soon. But I think housekeeping did a decent job of ensuring a good standard of cleanliness in the bathroom and bed, which were the only 2 places that mattered to me. However some comments are definitely true: Service could use a smile - I think most fast food places have friendlier service staff! The carpets made me wish I had slippers to walk around in, and anything else with a fabric surface have probably seen better days. Do not expect HDTV. And the location is not convenient for trying to shop/eat/be a tourist, so if you're trying to get around LA, renting a car would be useful.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: MissCarmelita
Reviews.Content: We got caught in flight cancellations & were finally shuttled by Amer.Airlines down to this hotel from John Wayne Airport. AA had given us a voucher for a free room after confirming they could host us. Woman at front desk was NOT happy & said they had no rooms. Then she had someone make a call & we got a room. I am not one to normally write reviews; BUT this was over the top for me. Room was the Dirtest room I've ever stayed in!! Carpet FULL of stains; Window COVERED completely in dirt. etc. I could not sleep that night thinking of the 'cuddies' I couldn't see. Then, after we got home, I saw the bill my husband had, AND they CHARGED US for the room!!!! Never Again.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: juillet_25
Reviews.Content: The best point of this hotel was transportation from/to the LAX. the room was big but not clean. The staff was not friendly and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a 1 night stay but very noisy hallways!”
Reviews.Author: Tojoru
Reviews.Content: This was just a 1 night stay before our flight the next day. The room was outdated but clean and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast buffet was OK but not worth the full price. We had the 50% off certificate. My only real complaint was the rudeness of other guests being very loud late into the night in the hallways and letting their doors slam. Needless to say we werent very well rested for our flight.

Reviews.Title: “intolerable service”
Reviews.Author: kitwithbell
Reviews.Content: Because departing time was early morning, I had made a reservation at Crowne Plaza Los Angeles-International Airport. After the trip, we arrived at hotel late night. Firstly, I stopped my car in front of hotel and took my luggages from the trunk. My wife checked in and asked if luggage service was available. Because of late night, almost 11 PM, we're answered it was impossible. We found that Luggage carter was also locked. As my 4 year old son had already fallen slept, my wife hasten and get into the room holding the slept son and I had no choice but waiting for her return in front of the hotel. That's because my luggages was there. A vallet parking service man was asking how im going to park my car. I answered that I was thinking to do self parking after my wife return. He strengthen to tell me that I was not able to stop over 20min in front of hotel. My wife had not return even after 20mins. I loaded my luggage into the trunk and parked at parking lot beside hotel. Actually, I was upset to my wife not returning promptly. Finally, I heard what happend from her. She tried to open the door holding my little son and failed it with the key she got. She went down to the counter and said that the key had problem. Receptionist got it, updated, and returned it silently. But the updated key also didn't work. A repair man came trying to open the door but he couldn't do it even with master key. We asked for changing the room and should wait for a long time to get another room. Even the repair man felt sorry however the receptionist didn't try to help anything and treated us very rude. we haven't heard anything to make us feel better, like Hello, Hi, thank you, Sorry etc from the receptionist. Hotel location is next to Airport, not bad. However, it's first time to experience this kind o service. This kind o things, key problem or door locking can be happened. However, the service of the receptionist an not be understandable. I never recommend this hotel due to unkind and rude service.

Reviews.Title: “Room and corridor were 1 star quality”
Reviews.Author: JBurton
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, Feb 16, 2010, on the way home from SE Asia. Got this place through Priceline for $42 plus taxes/fees. Stayed in room 411. The corridor and room were about 5 years late in getting refurbished. The wallpaper was peeling, the carpet was badly worn/stained, the bathroom needed a complete rehab, etc. I probably got the proverbial priceline room. Asked the desk clerk if any of the nearly 600 standard rooms had been upgraded lately and she said no, they all looked liked mine. Find that hard to believe. On the positive side, the bed was clean and comfortable, with lots of pillows. The lobby floor was the only area I'd consider 3 stars; the room/corridor was 1 star at best. This dump is in walking distance from LAX and they do have a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Worn down/Ants”
Reviews.Author: hallie4114
Reviews.Content: Got the room off price line for $50, which was a great price until we go there. The rooms were very worn down, and the first room I went into the bathroom was covered in ants. I mean hundreds of them... I went back down stairs and they changed my room to a different floor. We only stayed one night, which I was thankful for. The Crowne Plaza brand needs a serious upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Marked by Mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: howieeg
Reviews.Content: I really tried to have a good experience at the Crowne Plaza LAX. I realized the hotel is paddling water before a major renovation, but it really didn't have to be as mediocre as it was. Like many LAX hotels posturing at 3-plus star quality, it offers a hefty price for people who buy from its direct Web site or reservation line, while packing in the bulk of its clientele from near-give-away rates from Hotwire and Priceline. Stupid me, a Priority Platinum member... I thought I'd first get a decent price for an exectuive-level room and then get an automatic upgrade to a junior suite (which has occured in every other Crowne Plaza experience). The nice but rather dim receptionist insisted the my room on the club level WAS the upgrade and therefore would not qualify for a further upgrade to a suite. I was too exhausted to argue (first battling to get breakfast vouchers as promised on my reservation in black and white on print-out I showed her) and went to my room, only to find it is EXACTLY the same room with the same tacky furniture and grossly outdated mini-TV as all the other Crowne Plaza LAX rooms. Apparently, the club-level king room photo on the hotel's official Web site was misleadingly replaced with the bedroom from the one-bedroom suite. So, I had paid more than twice what the Priceliners had paid, and since the Executive Lounge was closed, I am one angry sucker. BTW, the breakfast, compared with the utterly delightful free breakfast at the nearby Renaissance LAX, was a bit of an unfunny joke, too -- little more than stale pastries and an empty scrambled egg bin. I feel a little bad, because generally the overworked staff seemed to be so nice. But the hotel managers really should take a close look at their competition.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the brand, but the 'Club' lounge was disappointing -- short hours.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelCouple
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for LA International Airport, rooms well sound-proofed for the airport noise. Comfortable, clean, what you'd expect from an Intercontinental Hotels Group up-brand. The 'club level' room was hardly different from their very pleasant regular rooms, and the 'club lounge' had very restricted hours -- perhaps because most guests are enroute to/from LA International Airport and so don't care about a separate semi-private lounge/bar open all day and all evening. That said, however, the club lounge manager went out of his way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible during the short hours his club was open -- excellent service, excellent food from his kitchen staff, generous wine pourings. He made all the difference in our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised... by how bad it was...”
Reviews.Author: tropicalM
Reviews.Content: I thought Crowne Plaza was supposed to be an above-average hotel chain... Maybe it was just this particular location that needed some improvements...? The problems I faced were: -room was very dated - loud air-conditioner -carpet was dirty -STAINS on the white bed cover -bathroom sink didn't drain well -bathroom appeared dirty -thin walls - and unfortunately, the person staying in the next room was coughing the WHOLE NIGHT (well not the hotel's problem) Glad I was only there for one night. Good things about this hotel were the location and its free shuttle service. It should be a 2.5-star hotel with an average nightly rate of $50.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, room issues, but not awfull”
Reviews.Author: Family_Guy
Reviews.Content: OK, on the whole this is an OK hotel, but a few things happend during my stay that bugged me, and if you read my other reviews it is clear that I am NOT someone that complains much. I was happy to get a great rate on Priceline for this hotel, but when I checked in I went up to our room, opened the door and there was a towel on the floor and the TV was on?? I thought I was barging in on someone so I had to yell "hello, hello" but the room was vacant. Looked like the cleaner failed to turn off the TV and left a dirty towel on the floor. Went to the "Dinning Room" for dinner, but the waiter walked us down the dinning room and through a door and sat us in the bar under a TV playing sports with no Explanation?? Other people were seated in there too and they also seem confused. I wanted to treat my wife to a nice dinner but ended up having pizza in the Pub! Yes I know I could of ordered off the main menu but why pay for a fancy meal if you have to eat it under a TV with some game I don't care about. Other than that it was prretty typical. I just get the impression that because most people probably only stay there one night before or after a flight, they don't worry about making you feel too comfortable. If you are booked into this hotel, don't worry, its fine, but I really did not feel it lived up to the Crowne Plaza name.

Reviews.Title: “Really needs a physical plant update”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: Room is full of paint chips, dirty filthy carpeting, loose grout in bathroom, etc. Room had ants, called down to front desk to request new room-told they were full. They did send up a maintenance person to "spray" the area. These ants were sturdy-still coming, called booking service to complain-suddenly CP had a room available. Manager was very polite and professional...but why did it take two calls to effect a room change? The staff can't help the quality of the room-which is poor-surely this company can update carpeting and provide some new paint and wallpaper. Additional front desk staff training and food service staff training would help as well.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt have believed it if I hadnt been there”
Reviews.Author: cpallo
Reviews.Content: WOW. I have just returned from a trip and was so blown away by this hotel that I had to take the time to write. It started with a rude front desk staff, who could not accomodate my room requests as they were "overbooked to begin with". I had prepaid the room well in advance, so how is this my issue? Went to the room, was unaware he had put me into a smoking room, until the elevator door opened and I was almost blown over by the stench. Went into the room and almost gagged from the smoke. The plain beige carpets looked almost paisley with the amount of multi colored stains that embossed (meaning that they were not all sunk in, some were "raised" stains - meaning more like gum on carpet). The carpet that comes up on the wall that acts as a baseboard was peeling off in some spots. The chair that is in the room had some grotesque soil marks on them - not sure what went on there. There were marks on the wall that looked like they may give you a disease if you touch them. UGH. As I could barely breathe, I had to complain to the surly front desk clerk, who reminded me that they were sold out. As I couldnt accept this, he was going to have his manager call me back. He then called back himself to let me know that they were having another room cleaned for me on a non-smoking floor. (Strange how that just came up, hmmm?). Moved into that room which was cleaner than the first, yet the carpet still looked soiled beyond belief and marks were on the wall here too. The bed was clean, but it was the kind that is so worn that you fall into the middle and then feel like you are trying to roll uphill to get back to the side. I checked the room to see if the sheets and towels were clean - the sheets were spotless, but one of the hand towels had a chunk of something that I can only hope was chocolate or caramel stick to it. Shocking. Unbelieveable. My friend said it well when he described the room as "something one expects to find at a seedy motel on route 66..." We stayed there due to its proximity to the airport, and this was the only positive thing I can come up with about this place. It was close.

Reviews.Title: “close to airport for convenience”
Reviews.Author: ford37
Reviews.Content: Used the Hotel as a resting point for an overnight stop over before flying out the next morning. Hotel staff were very friendly, the concierge was extremely helpful. The room was adequate without being outstanding, but the close location to the airport caused problems getting to sleep because of aircraft noise. Airport shuttle service was good, but could be a little drawnout depending on how many Hotels had to be visited for pick ups.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable bed and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: flowers52
Reviews.Content: We bid this hotel on priceline so it was a reasonable price. The bed was very comfortable. The room was clean, free shuttle to and from the airport. The check in staff was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “cplax”
Reviews.Content: The staff weren't the friendliest. I got a smoking room and then they changed it , but the new room had stains on the carpet. No view and no real lobby space.

Reviews.Title: “Thorougly average”
Reviews.Author: XCountryFlyer
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, my experience here was completely average compared to other more unfortunate guests. I'd rate the hotel 3 stars. Got the hotel for $39/night before taxes on Priceline. PL rates it 3.5 stars, but it really is a 3 star hotel. The overall amenities on paper may make it 3.5, but the reality isn't quite so good. Check-in service was fine. Got a room on the 10th floor and the room seemed clean enough, but I am not as picky as some. The windows are useless at keeping airplane noise out. Bring earplugs or sleep drugs if you have a hard time falling asleep. But if you're an airplane lover, a view of the runways is great. I didn't call the front desk for services or use the gym. Parking on 98th St. behind the hotel is free, limited to 2 hour stints from 8AM-12AM. They use white chalk on the rear tire when parking enforcement go by... Verdict: Was a thoroughly average hotel. If you're not getting this for cheap, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Its good for a night!”
Reviews.Author: dominik_r
Reviews.Content: Airport Hotels are mainly boring as they are mostly located in the middle of nowhere next to a highway. So one could judge such a hotel just for efficiency. The Crown Plaza LAX is such an efficient Hotel. Room décor is not my cup of tea, but they are fairly large and have everything you might need for your night over. Internet access was fast but they do charge for it. To be fair rates are cheap- 2 hours for 1,95USD. What I really like about American style Hotels are the vending machines on each floor as well as the laundry facilities. If you are traveling a lot with just cabin luggage your will appreciate this. I checked out the pool, but its far to small for some laps and not really nice. I had dinner at the Bar, which was quiet good- nothing special but does the job. There is a Starbucks in the Lobby if you just want grab a coffee in the morning before heading to the airport. The free airport shuttle was efficient. What else should I add? If rates are good I won’t hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Swan_tim
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times before for business due to clients being based near LAX, and it offers everything I need from a hotel. Free shuttle to and from the airport, clean rooms, restaurant and bar. It is generally offering a great rate too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if You Don't Mind Hearing the Planes”
Reviews.Author: abccorp
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal at the CP-LAX. Was really surprised by the level of service and the very nice facility. Unfortunately, however, they have not gotten around to sound proofing the rooms yet (at least mine) which took away from a good night's sleep. Other than that, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: FNC058
Reviews.Content: Spent one night due to a layover at LAX and found the hotel to be very beat up and not well maintained at all. The morning bellman was nice though the rest of the staff just seemed to be there and that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mikeygwm
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great Beds, Great Value, Great Service,

Reviews.Title: “When they leave ear plugs on your pillow, take the hint!”
Reviews.Author: fanball
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at the hotel to catch an early am flight to save us getting up at 3 am to drive to LAX. Needless to say there was no sleeping, the noise was HORRIBLE. The $175.00 bill even with the week of free parking was not worth it. Neither of us could sleep. Next time we will get up at 3:00 and drive the hour and a half, 4 hours of sleep is better than no hours of sleep. No FREE internet! I will look for another chain hotel that we have used before that has consistent levels of cleanliness and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great LAX stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: WellingtonQuadrant
Reviews.Content: Got a king sized room for US$80 from Wotif - what a bargain. Shuttle comes every 15 minutes, easy check in - great clean, comfy room. fabulous amenities and wonderful shower. This is a great place to stay for a late arrival into LAX or an early departure out of LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was wonderful at the hotel”
