Reviews.Author: ethis2me
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so wonderful at the hotel, the staff was great. It was quiet, fell right asleep when I layed my head on the pillow. Check in and check out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was amazing shuttle service was out of their control”
Reviews.Author: krasont
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great rooms were cleaned before noon. The only downfall was out of the hotels control. They have a shared shuttle and well seemed like I had to wait over 30 min everytime I took it back from the airport. They are suppose to run every 15 minutes but this did not seem to be the case

Reviews.Title: “Prefer other Lax Airport Hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: Normally we stay at the Sheraton Lax Airport Hotel but this time we decided to try the Crowne Plaza seeing we are Priority Club Members. There’s nothing much to say about this hotel than I wished we had stayed at the Sheraton. The hotel room was small, smelly and in need of a total revamp to make it into a reasonable standard. We arrived around 8pm and went looking for something to eat but the Brasserie Restaurant menu seemed limited and extremely ordinary, so we opted to walk across the road to the Sheraton and had a lovely meal in their Grill House Restaurant. The staff were helpful and friendly and we managed to use the shuttle bus in the morning to the airport which was handy. Overall – The hotel served a purpose as an overnight stopover hotel. Its reasonably priced but the rooms all need a major renovation. If on a budget then this hotel is okay however if looking for a little more regarding standards hop on over to the Sheraton Hotel you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: raindroplsc
Reviews.Content: My husband was traveling to CA for business and I decided tag along with the children (5 months and 2 yrs old). This hotel is in a great location right next to the airport. The downside is that it's right next to the airport. They have a sleep relaxation package that is suppose to help with the noise, so it might help with the noise. The noise doesn't bother me because my husband is a loud sleeper, so I adjusted to loud noises. If you're a light sleeper, than this is not the hotel for you. We were on the 16 th floor which is the primer floor, so the we had a wonderful of the landing strip which my 2 yr old love.\ We ate at the buffet since we received several coupons for. The breakfast was good, and the lunch was very good and tasty. I would recommend eating at the lunch buffet if you have a chance. Over all this is a good location and hotel, but may not be for families with small children. Rooms are a little small and the noise.

Reviews.Title: “the trick is out”
Reviews.Author: Craxiter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and the previous posting is completely correct, you should ask for a King nonsmoking on an upper floor on the north side. I have had only one stay that was on a lower floor facing south (Century Blvd) and that was the only time I was not very happy. I last stayed 3 nights, then 5 nights shortly after that. The Thursday jazz band was good even though I never thought I liked jazz. There are pricey items on the dinner menu but also fairly reasonable ones. Breakfast is perhaps a bit pricey but the continental buffet is not a bad deal, and the prices of the buffet include coffee. There is now a Subway a couple blocks west on Century Blvd. if you have restaurant sticker shock. I just discovered the steam room which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Solid place with good value”
Reviews.Author: peakbagger3
Reviews.Content: Solid standard clean convenient business/leisure hotel... Great location and dynamite if, like me, you get a sweet rate off priceline. Not the Ritz but very solid...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Blueonblue21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza near LAX for 11 days in July 2009. Within a few minutes of arriving at LAX, the hotel's shuttle bus was there to pick me up. The driver was helpful, polite, and friendly (don't forget to tip him!). I was standing in the hotel's lobby within minutes. The check in was fast (the clerk was very nice!). I was assigned to a room on floor four. Once there, the lady housekeeper saw that I was having some trouble finding my room. She quickly came to my aid (lovely lady!). The room was large, clean, comfortable, and well-designed (I have pictures. If you'd like to see them, just contact me. I'll E-mail them to you). The hotel was very busy the entire time I was there. Whenever I went down stairs to take a smoke, I'd see airline captains, children, parents, guests arriving 'round the clock. This is very much a family hotel. The concierge was always cheerful. The valets were always there (and busy). The lobby has plenty of brochures about local attractions. Very nice gift shop. The housekeepers were super! All in all, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience ever!!!!!!!Do not waste your time on this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LAcustomer
Reviews.Content: This is not the place to stay. The rooms are old and dirty, the staff is not very friendly, it is noisy and has unpleasant odors in the rooms and corridors. There were more than 10 very visible disgusting dark hairs (we counted) in the sink, shower and bathroom counter - I don't know how any decent housekeeper could miss this. Speaking of housekeeping, these maids apparently make it standard practice to open all doors of occupied guestrooms at 6am - we heard 4 doors slam, including ours. I mean Open - not knock or anything. I accidentally left something behind in the room and it magically disappeared within hours of my check-out, never to be seen again. Try the Sheraton or Marriot or anywhere else but here!

Reviews.Title: “The floor and room carpets were nasty!”
Reviews.Author: AL1470
Reviews.Content: The lobby is nice, but the seventh floor carpets were full of trash, and were not vacuumed during my stay. They looked like they had not been vacuumed in months. The carpet in my room had lots of stains. The outside of the room doors were scuffed and in need of paint. The furniture in the room was old and beaten. The beddings are usually very nice. There was a hair on the lamp. The bathroom wallpaper was peeling. The rooms and floors were similar to a US 2-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place so far”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer099
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. Rooms are extremely dirty-even towels and bed sheets.Carpets are dirty and some of the furniture broken. Staff seemed indifferent to complaints. We left the place!

Reviews.Title: “Is a good one”
Reviews.Author: TOURISTRIP
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay near to the airport i think is a good hotel, the rooms are nice, and also the location. I think the valet parking is a little bit expensive. I really recommended just if you need to stay near to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Old , noisy and expensive”
Reviews.Author: zorroartico
Reviews.Content: We didnt like it. Too bad for the price. The AC is extremly old and started making a loud noise in the middle of the night. We had to turn it off and then you can hear everything, street noise, airplanes and the other rooms!! This will be ok if it was cheap, but I really expected more for the price!

Reviews.Title: “This place was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby. Good view from the room. Not Too much LAX noise. It was a very good deal on Priceline. This area is convenient to Manhattan Beach, which I like.

Reviews.Title: “Most disgusting room ever! The Ron Jeremy Suite!”
Reviews.Author: nit72651
Reviews.Content: Just checked into the Crown Plaza at LAX, and it is the dirtiest, most disgusting room that I have stayed in in years-and I travel a great deal. From the hair on the supposedly clean towels, to the carpet that I will not even put a suitcase on, to the desk chair that I have covered with two towels. The whole place is just awful. Sold out, no other rooms available, and I am here for one night on our way home from Maui. There is no free internet, they charge to print boarding passes and the line to check in is nuts. Best thing that I can say about this dump is that there is an IN-n-OUT Burger within walking distance. Do NOT stay here-go to a homeless shelter-it will be cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is included - not even printing a boarding pass”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan6
Reviews.Content: I have in the past ranted about charges for high speed internet at higher priced hotels being ridiculous, but this property added a new level of wringing out the last dollar. This is an airport hotel, and I wished to print my boarding pass. In room internet - $10 or so, so I went to the business center - NOT FREE - they charge for use! So I went to the lobby kiosk for printing boarding passes - this charges both for the time on line and by the page. I had $2 in my pocket, so I figured I might as well do this as it appeared to be the cheapest option, but by the time the boarding pass was ready to print (2 pages, thus $1) I had less than $1 remaining - when I tried to go back to print just the first page, the system would not allow it and simply kept asking for more money until my time ran out. The good news, however, is that when I explained my frustration to the desk staff, she printed my pass immediately (no charge) and offered her apologies. Otherwise, an OK hotel very close to the airport and close enough to car rental return that you can drop your car off the night before and walk back to the hotel. Be aware that the shuttle stops at another hotel on the way to the airport and at all terminals, so it can easily be 15 minutes plus before you get back off. Check-in was slow as well - only 1 clerk working at arrival. Rooms need updating soon. I would likely try something else the next stay at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a Priceline hotel”
Reviews.Author: GigiMontclair_NJ
Reviews.Content: I read the mixed reviews, but we found the hotel convenient and the room fine with comfortable beds--very convenient to LAX. Like others, got it on a Priceline very reasonable bid. Entrance area does need updating, but the room was decent--we just wanted to get to sleep after our plane arrived after 10 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short airport stay”
Reviews.Author: bonjonsc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel via Priceline to use as a day room of sorts on our way out to Australia, as we didn't want to be in the airport from 3 p.m. until our midnight flight. The room was a bit dated-- especially the bathroom-- but the bed was comfortable enough for a quick nap. The hotel restaurant is a huge rip-off-- we had mediocre food for a very expensive bill and the wait staff were disinterested in clearing away plates and refilling our water glasses. There's only a Subway that's walkable for food from here. The hotel shuttle service was quick and efficient, however, so if you're looking for a quick stay, this place is fine. I wouldn't pay rack rate for it, though.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: judiebMunster_IN
Reviews.Content: Not what you'd expect from a Crowne Plaza - from parking in the filthy adjacent public garage to the equally disappointing room. Mildew on the shower curtain and broken tile under the counter. The carpeting in the room was not recently cleaned, either. The entire hotel - rooms, hallways, etc. could use refurbishing. I probably would have found far better accommodations near the airport in much the same price range, which is exactly what I'm going to do next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza to get over the flight from London. A shuttle bus runs regularly to the hotel, so I was there quickly after landing. The hotel is in a clutch of hotels along Century Boulevard, and is a fairly standard airport hotel. I had booked a "name your price" on Priceline for around $50. My room looked out the back of the hotel and was very quiet - just what I needed. I didn't use the internet service as it was not free - if you walk next door to the Sheraton Gateway you get free wireless in their lobby, so I used that instead! In the morning, it was a brief 15 minute walk to Dollar to collect my rental car. I was looking for a comfortable rest after a long flight, and that's what I got, for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza overbooked and we got bumped!”
Reviews.Author: sykesy116
Reviews.Content: After a flight from the East Coast, we arrived at the hotel around 1 am, only to find that they had no more rooms. As we had booked via the Crowne Plaza web site, paid in advance, and placed a note on the reservation that we'd be arriving late, we did not anticipate this. And we were not the only ones - there were at least 4 parties trying to check in around the same time with no luck. Luckily, the hotel was able to call around and find us a room in another hotel. However, they did not arrange for transportation to that hotel, so we had to take the shuttle back to the airport and then another shuttle to the new hotel. They also claimed they could not refund the room we booked on their website, as that's run by another company.

Reviews.Title: “Neeeds serious revamp plus better housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: ArchieNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally letting it go. It's rated as a 3.5 stars. However, this is what my experience was: I booked it through priceline, so I did not pay as much, but I can't imagine paying full rate. Dirty carpets, old bathrooms with hair everywhere. Not even flat screen TV. Only a regular 25 inch screen. The walls in the common areas are scratched by items moved in and out. Very dissapointing experience. Although, I only used to sleep, it really does not deserve to be rated as a 3.5 stars. The only great thing is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Marjol
Reviews.Content: We were here for one night after arriving in Los Angeles for a 2 week holiday in California. We booked the hotel for $45 through Priceline and for that money, this was an excellent deal.The airport noise didn't bother us and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pedeva99
Reviews.Content: This is your standard airport hotel. Given the large number of hotel rooms around LAX - make sure to use one of the bid sites as you will pay alot less this way than the quoted rates. Check-in was quick and efficient. Hotel is very busy with lots of people in the lobby and bar areas. Room was clean and had standard Crowne Plaza fittings. Was abit shabby in places. TV needed replacing as picture was awful. Served its purpose for a one night stay. Parking $12 per night

Reviews.Title: “Decent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greatone3800
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline with a $45/night bid (just under $60 with fees) for a Saturday night stay. It's a 3.5 star hotel on priceline. Checkin/out: Fast and easy. Requested two double beds at check-in and requested was honored with no issues. Checked out over the phone. Again, fast and easy. Room: Basic room. Certainly not fancy, kind of worn and dated but has all the basic amenities. We had a room on the 8th floor that faced the runway, but airport noise was not an issue (they do provide ear plugs if you need them). The traffic below was louder than the airport but even that wasn't too bad. Parking: There's self parking for $12/day in the garage next door. Unlimited in and out when you pay through the hotel. Decent price given the location. Overall, average hotel...what I would expect from an airport hotel. I wouldn't mind staying here again, but certainly wouldn't pay the regular price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine... Does the job.”
Reviews.Author: jmlls07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine to lay your head down before or after a flight. However, it is most definitely a 3 star. The service was decent, the staff was very accommodating, and the communal areas were presentable and acceptable. The elevator itself was dingy, the hallways a bit musty, and the rooms were starting to show its wear. Though the bed and bedding was acceptable and comfortable, the carpets were stained, the bathroom a bit worn out with slight mildew, but I was still okay with showering without shower shoes... I just made sure to walk around the bathroom and room with flip flops or socks on. Again, the hotel is fine. Its nothing spectacular, but with my Priceline rate of $45/night, who am I to complain? It did its job, and I would mind sleeping here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: pilotboy1985
Reviews.Content: I booked ths hotel using Priceline. It was the first time I've bid on a hotel before and was unsure on what to expect with such a low rate. We got off our Cruise at San Pedro at 9:30am, and got to the Hotel about 10:00am Sunday morning. I figured there was no way we could check in, but they could store our luggage anyway. At Check-in the guy was very nice and pleasant. I asked if it was possible to check in early, as I realized this is 5 hours before check-in. He explained it wouldn't be a problem, and it would be his pleasure to ensure we had a good room for us right away. We were in room 911, which had a nice king sized bed. The room was large, and had a view of the airport. I'm an avid Airplane Spotter, so I didn't mind this at all. The bed was very comfortable. We went down to the front desk and asked about the area, he explained there is a Trolly service for $3 return which will take you to Manhattan beach and back to the hotel, and runs every 15 minutes. We purchased our tickets there and out we went. He spent the afternoon in Manhattan beach, and returned to the hotel. The staff welcomed me back. We left the next morning at 5:00am, and the shuttle was there no problem. A great stay all in all. This hotel takes the record for the cheapest hotel I've paid for, however I would of gladly paid two, if not three times the amount to stay here again. Thanks Crowne Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “No hot water, internet did not work in room”
Reviews.Author: AlaskansNeedtotravel
Reviews.Content: Flew all the way from Alaska to LAX. Wanted a shower before bed. The boilers were broke in the building. No hot water. Next morning I called downstairs. Internet is usually $4.95 for 4 hrs in the room. I asked them since we had no hot water the night before if they would just let me have the internet for free so I could check my email. They were really nice and put it in my room. Although I had it I spent almost an hour trying to check email. There were issues so I couldn't even use it. I think they should have said sorry about last night and gave us free breakfast or something. Beds were very comfortable and the room was pretty clean and I am really picky about clean. Overal the room felt modern but if you looked close they still had like a light gold wallpaper on the walls. Not very happy about having no hot water. Gave us earplugs but I never heard any airplane noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerCouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights, and really enjoyed our stay. The highlights 1. Room. This was the best part. It was actually practically a junior suite, with an area with a microwave, fridge, sink, coffee maker, and a decent amount of granite counter space. The only difference is the kitchenette area was not separate from the bed area, and there was no table. But if you're expecting just a room, at a room rate, this was a pleasant surprise. The bed was a California king, and had a mattress and sheets of good quality. We also had a balcony. 2. Location. The hotel is right across the street from the beach. Of course being right on the beach would have been even better, but we were pretty darn close. 3. Clean and Friendly. The entire staff was prompt, professional, and kind. 4. Free Wireless. There were only a few minor downsides. 1. Lack of local attractions. If all you want is nice beach, then you'll be very happy. But other than that, there isn't really anything in walking distance in terms of food or attractions. It's mostly a residential area for locals (lots of condos). We were one of the few hotels. 2. Jacuzzi is not indoors. If the weather is nice, then this isn't a problem at all. And one last note about weather in February...We were trying to get out of the New York winter, and hoped Florida would be far enough south for some warm weather. It was 74 - 78 degrees on the thermometer during our stay, but it was still quite windy, and cloudy at times--enough to keep the locals off the beach, and only those who paid for the flight and hotel could be found on the sand. We had a decent time, but if we did it again, we'd wait further out than February to do a beach trip in the Miami/Hollywood area

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmh... not the best choice”
Reviews.Author: MarioMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint is that the Crowne Plaza is dated. Rooms are not only ugly but old. I asked for a smoking room which are usually not the best smelling but this one seemed to have stale smoke from like 20 years ago. The carpet was potholed with cigarrette burns, so it was not the best experience. On the upside, the staff is nice, hotel is super close to the airport and shuttles run very very frequently. Value for money $50 for one weekday night on Priceline is ok but I'm sure a bit more money would've gotten me something much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: MarkhMD
Reviews.Content: Purposely stayed for proximity to LAX. Typical airport hotel geared for business travelers, which I expected. Room was clean, rate was very affordable $99. Only beef is there was a single cup coffee maker and only one coffee. Obviously geared for single traveler. Not a big enough deal to go downstairs or call housekeeping for more, but a nit.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: flyinprincess
Reviews.Content: We had a lay over in LA, so I got on Priceline and booked the room for a great price. The shuttle was quick and efficient, although we happened to catch the shuttles in the evening and the morning that all the pilots and stewards used, which made for some cramped quarters. I would suggest getting up early to get a shuttle. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean. They were kind enough to provide ear plugs, which were necessary given the proximity to LAX. If you plan on eating in the morning, do it at the airport (I can't believe I'm even suggesting that). The food was outrageously expensive in the resturant downstairs in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice at LAX”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Crowne Plaza because of a Priority Club promotion. I usually stay at the Hilton or Sheraton which are on the same block of West Century Ave. Of the three, the Crowne is my least favorite. Check-in was slow. There were five people in line ahead of me when I arrived and only one clerk, and although he was friendly, he did not move quickly. I was given a room on the 16th floor facing the airport. The room was very standard: nothing special or bad about it. The bed was clean and comfortable. I was surprised at how bad the noise from the street outside and the airport were. Having stayed recently at both the Hilton and the Sheraton, I know that airport hotels can be somewhat soundproof: you hear the airport there, but it's not bad. Here, the plane noise was so loud that I could not hear the television in the room when a plane took off or landed. They do provide earplugs which did help. I was surprised to find that they don't provide a way to most guests to print boarding passes for free: you have to pay $4.95 to use the business center or $3.00 to use a third party vendor's internet service. They allowed me to use the business center for free as a frequent guest of the Intercontinental Family of Hotels. I thought this was really strange for an airport hotel. The food I ordered from room service was delivered quickly and was very tasty. They made a mistake and included something I did not order: they took that back and corrected the bill without problems. I expected more, and got less. I will go back to the Sheraton and the Hilton, even if these cost a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: fraserkrane
Reviews.Content: The staff at crown plaza were incredibly helpful. They were actually interested in helping me best use my limited time in LA. The restaurant is great - the food is delicious , service great and a pleasant surroundings in an atrium. the trips they suggested made best use of the day i had. the best was a swim in the pool under the stars before my flight. thanks guys. this is the stop in la for me.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western is better than this!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissTLI
Reviews.Content: Check-in for 2 rooms was easy, but one of the room keys was not programmed well and wouldn't open the door right after we went up. Strangely, there was no house phone in front of the elevator, or was it hidden somewhere?! That night, our internet did not work at all, so we gave FD a call. The man, to my shock, said to me: Sorry Miss, this is front desk not technician desk. And pushed my problems away to some 1-800 number. (Our laptop is PC. And at 11pm to call 1-800 who obviously was not inside the property, I could not see any solutions to it!! At this moment I was so pissed). Fine, but could you check my bills see if I got charged twice? I asked the man politely. He replied right away "No you wouldnt get charged. I will be sure you wouldnt get charged." So he did not even open up my bills in the computer at all!! This man, he did not mention his name. I said, Smart move! If this is IHC's standard, I have nothing else to say. Would I come back to stay with them? NO!! And I dont think they give a damn about it!!!! PS. Housekeeping and engineer is wonderful. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lived up to the expetations”
Reviews.Author: Hakker
Reviews.Content: Our last hotel on our 3 week trip. A friendly welcome in a hotel with all conveniences. The room was large, the beds excellent. All very clean and very well looked after. The hotel is one block away from LAX, but we didn't here any airplane. One mishap, the trainee forgot to book our wake-up call. However, our complaint was acknowledged and we got a full compensation !. Crowne Plaza is a hotel to remember for a next stay in the US.

Reviews.Title: “avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: star0904
Reviews.Content: We stayed two horrible weeks at the lax crown plaza and I would never go back there! First of all these employees need to learn something about customer service and about their job!Front desk was acceptable, food was OK, but the service was very poor and overall they should really work on their customer service skills. Second of all security....their so called business center was equipped with as many as three computers and during one of my visits some cash disappeared...mysteriously... And finally, let me mention that every time we requested something to be brought up to our room, it took at least a second phone call and at least 40 minutes before it actually was delivered to the room...except for room service, which actually made it faster (including the preparation time) than any other request. The only thing I found appealing was the hot tub which was quite nice for a change. There are so many choices in that area, don't let it ruin your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my stay”
Reviews.Author: roroji
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to LA for a wedding. I reserved the hotel through Priceline for $65 a night for three nights. I was really surprised on how nice the hotel was. I guess since the hotel is next to LAX and the reviews that I've read about how noisy it was. I loved it and I plan on staying there next time I go to LA. Better than Westin. Clean rooms, good customer services by the guest service, nice restaurant and lounge. They also have a car wash on site. Since we drove from Sacramento, we needed it. Very convenience. I loved it and recommend it. I hope you have the same satisfying experience as my husband an I did.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Cozy and Clean Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: csto78
Reviews.Content: I got this room on Priceline. When I checked in around 10 pm on a Friday night, the desk was well staffed and check in was accomplished in minutes. I chatted up the desk clerk and he was extremely cordial, comping a buffet breakfast for me. He also moved my room to a Quiet Zone so I could get some rest. I was concerned about the noise at this hotel based on previous reviews, but really did not have any problems. You have to realize that this is an airport hotel, so there are arrivals and departures of guests and planes all day, every day. It's not a place to sequester yourself for a relaxing getaway. It's intended as a safe, clean and comfortable place to sleep, eat and shower. There is a free shuttle to/from the airport. It is efficient and quick. The room service menu is quite reasonable and the food is hearty and a good value. I would stay here again, but only if I got it on Priceline. I would not pay more than $80 for a room like this.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: hhvdragon
Reviews.Content: Seriously- I would not recommend this hotel no matter what price you can get. I wouldn't stay here again if they paid me. The shuttle does run okay and the restaurant food was okay. But the front desk staff is completely unhelpful and apparently doesn't understand the concept of customer service. The room was tired and the glasses in the bathroom were not clean. I suspect the towels were not as clean as they could have been either. The hallway was run down and dark and just didn't have that safe feeling that you should get in a hotel of Crowne Plaza's self proclaimed quality. Actually, I have like any other Crowne Plaza I have stayed in, but this one was just awful. I had a problem with someone trying to get in my room (don't know if they were lost or front desk gave them a key to an already rented room- oddly this happened to a reviewer who stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Seattle as well) and then my key wouldn't work. The front desk staff acted like that happened all the time and there was never a manager available to help, nor did I recieve a response from a manager, as requested. You can get comparable rates at many hotels in the area. The Hilton LAX has been renovated and I think they have undergone a change in management because the last 2 times after the Crowne Plaza incident, I stayed at the Hilton and the service was terrific both times. Bottom line, for the money you will pay, find somewhere cleaner, friendlier and safer.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a night. . .but bring your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: lovemypup
Reviews.Content: I got a tremendous rate on hotwire and so I stayed here the night before I left for a cruise in the South Pacific. I waited in what seemed like a VERY long, slow line to check in. . .it took over 20 minutes at 10:30pm. Once I got up to the counter, however, since I was prepaid, they gave me a key and sent me on my way. I had a very nice room on the 14th floor, although it was literally on one of the airport runways, and was exceptionally loud. The fan/ac in the room would turn itself off, so I couldn't use that as white noise, and I didn't use the earplugs since I didn't want to miss my alarm. . .so, every couple of hours I was woken up with some huge plane taking off right outside the window. I was hungry after traveling across the country, and went to eat dinner downstairs, except they don't really have a restaurant that's open that late. So, I ordered a pizza and a soda, and took it to my room. It was actually very tasty, albeit a bit expensive. I found the bed very comfortable, the room quite large, and the bathroom nicely appointed. The toiletries were basic--but it isn't the Four Seasons. I did, however, appreciate the relaxation cd, the eye mask, and the earplugs. It was a thoughtful touch! I would definitely stay here again given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient yet dated”
Reviews.Author: travel55plus
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right next to LAX, so its very convenient. They also have a free frequent shuttle bus to and from the terminal. Lobby is nice, late 1980s decor. Many flight crews stay here. Rooms and hallways are also very dated, rooms are clean, nothing fancy. I booked the hotel thru priceline, got it for $75. a night, for that price its worth it. Tried to book directly with hotel, for $170, its not worth that price. Be wary of trainees, I was told I would have to pay for my own parking, when a manager stepped in a gave me a free voucher. Also arrived early, manager/clerk on duty was very helpful, got us into a room on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Good, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: zodiac6573
Reviews.Content: I quite liked this hotel as it is extremely convenient to the airport without the aircraft or traffic noise, and all the staff I encountered, whether at the reception desk, in the restaurant, room service and the like were friendly and courteous. The rooms are clean and I really liked the relaxation/jet lag CD they provided. My only complaint was that reception staff would often give preference at check-in to airline staff, whilst ignoring other guests who were also waiting to check in. Otherwise, I cannot fault this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MrSpeyk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, what I remember of it. Straight off the plane and to bed! Nice club floor room, complientary breafast in the club lounge. Decent price, quick transfers and close to the car hire places if you are collecting a car. I will use this hotel again, good, clean, polite, you name it.

Reviews.Title: “Does this property have a manager?”
Reviews.Author: jean8239
Reviews.Content: Yes this rating is a bit harsh. But with so many hotels in the LAX area why wouldn't a hotel that is part of a major chain try to do better for its guests? Because there are suckers like me who continue to book rooms despite other negative reviews. Not only did we stay there in April, we also just got back from another stay- so this is not a repeat review just a review of both stays. Two times- we really are stupid. Anyway, on neither occasion did they honor the room type we booked and paid for. On one stay the room card was messed up repeatedly as noticed by other travelers. There were several problems with housekeeping. Ironically lipstick marks were part of all of those problems. Either take away cosmetics before guests check in or learn how to wash glasses and towels. On both stays, there was no manager whatsoever who could speak with us. We never recieved a phone call as requested. In April I had taken the time to write a letter. I never even recieved a response. Now that's just rude. I'm writing a letter this time too, but doubt I will hear anything. Feel free to contact me if you want my pros and cons on LAX airports. I stay a lot. So maybe you shouldn't contact me because I was stupid enough to stay here twice.

Reviews.Title: “Pitiful Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreMae
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the web from Thailand so would have decent place to stay after 25 hours travel. I paid $159+ which came to $188. I saw poster that said if you can't rate us Very Satisfied to let us know. I went to share the comments and the GM, Mgr., and Asst Mgr all strangely unavail. or in "closed door meetings". I gave my notes to a very nice lady at the front and she promised I would receive a reply by email which NEVER happened. I wasn't going to miss the shuttle to LAX so I didn't hang around. Here's the scoop>>>I agree with the overall theme of most reviews in that there is a pitiful perceived value at the standard price which I paid. I didn't want to gamble with Priceline so I paid the full asking price. Not a good feeling knowing a lot of others claim to have paid way more than 1/2 off ($60) what I paid. The peace of mind full boat reservation isn't worth it!. The provision of ear plugs in the room was a bad omen. The roar of jet thrust was deafening and made sleep difficult. Zero soundproofing. The window curtain had a gap at the sill and flooded the room in sunlight requiring me to pile comforters and pillows to get the room dark. Furniture stained. Coffee maker dirty. I supervise 175 furniture stores so I know a worn out mattress when I try one. Deep body impression and hump in the middle was somewhat masked by luxury duvet spread. The bathroom sink was stopped up. Plaster on the bathroom ceiling was cracked. Come on guys, this is Cal.: the pool is micro, shallow, and terribly located for sun. Well worn carpeting. Staff and the buffet breakfast were fantastic. CP site had dead link and poor shuttle directions.Never again. Shameful.

Reviews.Title: “Just Adequate - But Disappointing For A Crowne Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: bealine
Reviews.Content: Usually, we stay in Holiday Inn properties as the standards are similar worldwide. The Crowne Plaza properties are owned by Holiday Inn and are usually upmarket, whilst Holiday Inn Express properties are pleasantly comfortable, but more basic. After staying in the Crowne Plaza at Muscat in February, we expected a high standard at the Crowne Plaza, Los Angeles Airport - after all, "Tinseltown" is the showpiece of the USA! Unfortunately, the standards fell far short of our anticipations and, whilst the hotel and the room was clean, efficient and comfortable, we found the staff surly and not very helpful - indeed the "Bell" staff stood around watching as guests struggled in from the airport courtesy bus with their baggage! The complimentary coffee in the room has a disgusting flavour, only drowned out by heaps of sugar. Unfortunately, the hotel is really cost cutting with just one sachet of coffee and two tiny sachets of sugar provided for a family room. The courtesy shuttle stops at the Airport Airtrain Stop "P4" which is a pain if you have bags. This, however, is not the hotel's fault, it is the airport operator and the security services who have stopped the courtesy buses visiting the airport terminals since 09/11. The complimentary Wireless Internet is painfully slow and reminded me of the old days of "dial up" and the "World Wide Wait" on a Friday evening! We needed to check in on Continental Airlines website which took us over an hour. Even checking emails involved a long spell of hour-glass watching! All in all, the hotel was adequate for our needs but we would have been bitterly disappointed if we hadn't had a good rate ($99 for 3 people). Did we complain? No - nothing to complain about really, both the coffee and the internet, my main beefs, were free! Would we stay again? No, there are better properties at competitive rates, including the Holiday Inn which is IMHO better, nearby.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: onerpm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late June, 2008. $60/night for each of 2 rooms, Thursday thru Saturday nights via bidding on Priceline. I was definitely satisfied. Free shuttle still runs to/from airport. Directly behind the hotel is 98th street, with lots of free parking along one side (2 hour limit between 8a and midnight, though). I had no problem finding a spot all 3 nights. Budget rent-a-car is right across the other side of 98th. Other rental car agencies are within a short walk as well. You can easily save some money by picking up your car the morning after you arrive, and returning it the day before you leave, and taking the hotel shuttle to/from LAX. The free parking makes that less worthwhile, though. Small outdoor swimming pool on 2d floor does not get sun in the morning. Outdoor hot tub by pool; sauna just inside from pool. 3d floor has a small gym with a couple bikes, couple treadmills, couple ellipticals, a single multi-task weight machine, some dumbbells, etc. Lobby is pretty nice, with a bar, sushi cart, krispy creme outlet, starbucks outlet, and a coffee shop/restaurant. Prices are reasonable for room service compared to many hotels - $10.50 for an omelet. Rooms are a little dated, but not that bad. Rooms have nice beds, a curtain clip, one-cup coffeemaker, HBO. No safe, though. VERY close to LAX, but I was not on the LAX side, and heard no airplanes from my 10th floor room. My kids had a room on the LAX side on 11th floor, and did complain of the noise. The windows open a couple of inches.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not worth full price”
Reviews.Author: blinken
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two nights in June. Check in was easy, the staff was pleasant. Had a room with two queen beds on the twelfth floor. The hotel is very close to the airport; close enough to get a very good view of one runway and the takeoffs and landings happening there (my son enjoyed this). Despite the proximity, airport noise was not intrusive. Room was decent and clean. Nothing spectacular. The beds were excellent - very comfortable. Parking is something of a hassle, though that's not unusual in LA. Self parking is $12/day, valet is $16. We got the room through Hotwire at $84/night. At this price I was very satisfied with the hotel. At the same time I booked, if I had used a normal travel site or the hotel directly, it would have been $199/night. Not worth the full rate in my opinion. Not sure why more expensive hotels tend to charge extra for amenities that mid-level chains often provide for free, but the Crowne had no complimentary breakfast, or even coffee (except in-room brew your own). Wireless internet was an additional charge. Use of the computers in the lobby or business center were an additional charge. Annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport means lots of noise!”
Reviews.Author: RaddogUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to break up a flight from NZ to the UK, stopped here using Priority Club loyalty points. Hotel is very close to the airport on Century Boulevard, but then all the major hotel brands are available in this vicinity too. My Club room overlooked the airport and was NOISY!!! No soundproofing in this room, that's for sure! This is pretty representative of the older style Crowne Plaza, rooms are a little bit tired, but the excellent bed and bedding reflects the emphasis the brand put on having a great night's sleep. My room was incredibly noisy, the old style aircon unit drowned out the TV on a "normal" volume setting and the constant overnight aircraft movements were very intrusive. There isn't really a good reason to reccomend this hotel unless you want somewhere where you know traffic won't delay your trip to the airport. All other major hotel chains are in the same area, the others are probably a bit quieter being a block back from the Crowne Plaza. $12 for 24hours in\out parking was fine too. The maid was using a vacuum cleaner in the corridor outside my room at 6am too which was unacceptable in my view.

Reviews.Title: “Okay service, worth the price on priceline”
Reviews.Author: travelerAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Service was less than stellar, room had a laundered towel that had a dried lipstick stain on it. Proximity to LAX and free shuttle to the airport made it very worth the low price on priceline. WOULD NOT PAY REGULAR RATES.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport accommodation”
Reviews.Author: glumball
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel three times in the past six months. The beds are super comfy, the rooms we have been allocated have been spacious - although old they have been well mantained. On our last trip we were allocated rooms on the quiet floor (see photo). The buffet breakfast is good value but would be enhanced by omelettes etc made to order. It would also be beneficial to have free wireless internet access as provided in other area hotels although the option of 4 hours for $4.95 suited our needs. The staff aren't overly attentive yet we have had no need to call on them to remedy issues. It is disappointing that our email regarding lost property from October 2007 has never been answered. After trying out the Holiday inn at LAX on our last LA visit we will return to the Crowne Plaza and have made a booking for our next trip in two months time. We find it convenient to take the hotel shuttle from the airport then after a good night's sleep stroll to Hertz to collect a rental car. The hotel's location provides a good base for touring the Los Angeles area by car.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Travellover49
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is old and dirty. Carpet looks very bad. Not tell the truth about what kind of room they have. Reception is not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: kelpie99
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is one of the closest hotels to LAX and easy to find along Century Blvd. The rooms are a nice size, and the t.v has over 50 channels without any annoying pay per view service. The restaurant prices are actually reasonable and offer quite a variety of food. There is a sushi bar in the lobby, a quick service restaurant, pizzeria, starbucks and a regular restaurant all in one place. Room rates are reasonable and beds are comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDoubleJ
Reviews.Content: We did Priceline's name your own price and got this great hotel for $60 a night. It really was much nicer than other 3* hotels we've stayed at. We flew into LAX, picked up our rental car, and drove 2 blocks to the hotel. Although parking cost $12/day, we felt we were still getting a better deal than we would have anywhere else. It wasn't close to much and the surrounding neighborhoods weren't the best, but as for the hotel itself and its immediate neighbors, we felt fine. It was close to freeways and we had easy access to get where we needed to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, but you'll need those earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: I actually flew in and out of the Long Beach airport, but stayed here after a few days' stay in Anaheim because I had some things to do in the western Los Angeles area... and because I'm a bargain fiend who couldn't resist the $70 Entertainment Card rate! This is a clean, classy place with all the comforts one would expect from a 3* hotel: nice amenities, comfortable sheets, with a choice of pillows. As a Priority Club Gold member, I requested a room far from the elevator, and my wish was granted--room 1004 was the last room on my side of the wing. There was no hotel noise--I never heard from my neighbors nor heard doors slamming, etc. The same, however, cannot be said for airport noise. The hotel is one of the closest to the airport, and right between the two main runways. The windows really need to be triple-paned, and they aren't. I came in at 1:30 AM, and it's amazing how many planes are landing even at that ungodly hour. That being said, I need earplugs for some reason or another 2/3 of the time I go to hotels, so I just used the ones provided and slept well. The hotel is actually pretty convenient to the beaches, Westwood, and the Getty museum. If you can get the Entertainment Card rate, it will save you a bundle from the price of a hotel with comparable quality in Santa Monica or Westwood. I don't think you can beat the value without Priceline. Oh, and you get a free beer or Starbucks drink if you're Priority Club Gold...

Reviews.Title: “Shout out to Adril!!!”
Reviews.Author: cridge
Reviews.Content: Ok just returned from LAX and the hotel was fine enough for an overnight stay! I saw MANY flight attendants staying at the hotel so you know it must be a decent place? Good: STAFF - ADRIL you are the BEST!!! We came into the restaurant 30 minutes to close and he says "NO PROBLEM!" Tells us to go and have a seat in the comfy lounge! Margerheta (sorry spelling) was super with our 4 year old and brought her a Shirley Temple to go with our pizza! Good: Bedding was sooo nice and comfy! Similiar to the Westin's heavenly bed! They included a sleep CD and really nice aromatherapy sleep spray for the linens! Good: Krispee Kreme donuts and Starbucks coffee for sale in their cafe....yum! Could be ALOT Better: The shuttle was full by the time it picked us up at gate 7 and we waited - no lie - 1.5 hours for the shuttle to take us to the hotel....grrrrrr. Room Key: similiar to other review(s) our room key did not work the first time either. Strange. Anyways I would definately at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Third time a charm??”
Reviews.Author: Boppers
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel. It took 3 trips to my room to check in (first the card didn't work, second the card did and the room was dirty, then bingo). I understand they were working from a computer system but all I got was a sorry. I hauled my luggage up 3xs. The rooms were remodeled but they smelled funny. The "sleep soundly kit" was missing parts of the kit (earplugs) and it took 2 tries to get a set to my room. On a pseudo positive note (just wait) the restaurant has revamped its food and menu (Excellent shrimp appetizer!) and is really great especially if you don't want to leave the hotel or have an early flight (its usually both for me). However the service was the absolute worst I have had in a long long time. I couldn't get my waitresses attention to save my life! The free airport shuttle was late and therefore it became packed with flight crews and guests. (They say every 15 mintues but I think that's a lie). I am really an easy going person but there were just too many instances that added up to a bad stay. I am going to stay somewhere else next time and there are plenty of choices near the airport that can beat the service at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a LAX hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GovTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while I was attending training very close. It was super convenient, within walking distance. The noise from the airport was minimal. My window overlooked the Rental Car return lots. There was a 10.95 charge for the wireless internet, but it was easy to logon and I had no problems with billing for the one day I used it. It was faster than my connection at home. My cell phone reception was good (AT&T). I didn't have to use the telephone except to call my colleagues in the hotel and the desk - and there was no charge for that. My room was a little older, but relatively clean and comfortable. For government rates, I think it was about right. The TV was a little out of focus. My colleagues said their beds were wonderful, but mine was just okay. I loved the little baggie with linen spray, ear plugs and a eye mask. The extra pillows were nice. One of my colleagues had a problem with her wake up call and got a free night. I had no problems with the wake up call (the alarm clock was too much for me to figure out). The breakfast buffet was excellent for the price (FREE!). We were a little disappointed that the free drink coupon only covered house wine and beer. But they had a live band the night we went there. The parking structure was terrific. Much better than other airport hotels at which I've stayed. Very easy to find a spot. It felt very safe. $12/day with unlimited in and out. The parking lot attendant was very courteous. All the staff I dealt with at the hotel were very nice. The breakfast server was very friendly -- he remembered I drank tea. I will stay here again and recommend it to anyone who is attending training in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: readymade
Reviews.Content: I can only shake my head at some of the negative reviews of this place. There's nothing wrong with it. It's a perfectly fine 3* property. Yes, it's not brand new, but it's not "run-down." Everything worked fine, it was comfortable, clean, and convenient. There is almost nothing in the way of restaurants nearby, but if you have a car you can go over to Sepulveda Blvd. nearby where there are tons of places. The self-park is $12 in a garage across from the front and towards the side of the hotel. I found absolutely nothing to complain about, particularly at $60 on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Layover in LAX”
Reviews.Author: jinapsan
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this property for one night after a late night arrival from South America. Airport Shuttles to the Hotel were frequent. However my only complaint concerning the shuttles was that the shuttle was marked only "Express". There was no indication which hotels the shuttles were headed. After seeing a couple of the shuttles pass by and no shuttles indicating the Crowne Plaza appeared I called the hotel only to find out that it was these shuttles I needed to board. Once I got on the shuttle however, the trip to the hotel was quite fast with one stop at a park and ride. Check in at the hotel was also fast and efficient. I was upgraded since I was a Platinum Priority Club Member. I found the hotel room to be quite nice. The bed was large and comfortable. I was pleasantly surprised to see that a sleep soundly amenity kit with CD, blindfolds, earplugs and aromatherapy lotion was provided. The bathroom was standard with the usual amenities. I was provided with vouchers for breakfast and two vouchers for free drinks/cocktails or starbucks coffee. The breakfast buffet was quite good and the service staff quite pleasant and helpful. I also was not charged for internet access. All in all I found this hotel to be quite nice and would definitely consider staying there again if I find myself transiting through LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: christialle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit of a mixed bag, some aspects of the hotel are excellent, others average to poor. The Rooms: Comparable to more expensive hotels, spacious and tasteful decor, very clean. One big negative is that they are still charging for wireless internet access, seems a bit chintzy. Shuttle to Airport: Fast and frequent. Service: All staff at the hotel are really good, friendly and helpful. Food etc: This is where the hotel suffers terribly. The food is very over priced, and seems about on par with Dennys and Applebees except at upscale prices. Did I mention that it is really expensive? It is. If you stay here, make sure you have a car so you can find a decent restaurant. There is nothing in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kaycimbrazell
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza is a wonderful place to stay in LA. The staff was extremely accomodating and friendly. The rooms were very nice and clean, and it's extremely resonable price wise. The restaurant has good food too. The only negative that occured is the frontdesk charged the wrong credit card at check out and this caused all kinds of problems. I still don't have my money back. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX shuttle reliable”
Reviews.Author: goo0325
Reviews.Content: Room was worn out as this hotel is used by flight crews and mostly one night guests in and out of LAX. Guest room was worn, but clean. Public areas were great and restaurant was good. Front desk and all other employees were friendly. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: uklad79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very overpriced for what we paid on the hotels website. $200 for a very poor hotel in this chain. I am a platnum priority club member instead of an upgraded room I got a room with peeling paint, chipped and scraped furniture, and windows with little to no sound proofing. My room was on the runway side and it was appaling that the windows were not sound proof like other airport hotels. The hotel has had a minor facelift but it needs much more doing as the rooms are still poor with the 80's bathrooms, missing tiles in the hot tub that can cut you, vending machines that only take creditcards, dirty laudry room that had never been refitted since the hotel opened, and the replacing of windows with sound proof ones. It's obvious this hotel is owned by a geedy company that doesn't give a toss as it can screw loads of money from people due to the location. I think alot of their work is contracts to put up airline crew who most likely don;t care as they are not paying.

Reviews.Title: “Good for layover”
Reviews.Author: AkFishinQueen
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline for $60 for an overnight layover and stayed on November 3rd and November 10th. Check-in was quick. The rooms we stayed in each time were identical. King bed that was very comfortable. Bathrooms looked a little dingy but I've seen much worse. On the first night of our trip we arrived around 11:30, and left at 8:00 in the morning. The last night of our trip we arrived at 8:00pm and left in the morning at 9:00am. We tried to eat in the restaurant, and after waiting as staffed passed back and forth in front of us, someone eventually seated us. The table settings were in disarray and there was only one glass with water still in it from the last group. The restaurant only had about 6 or 7 parties seated, so it wasn't very busy. However, after 5 minutes nobody came to even take a drink order so we left. We did order pizza from room service - the price was reasonable and the pizza decent. Don't waste time in the restaurant - just get room service. Overall, I would stay again if I had to overnight near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: BobtheBrit
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews of this hotel here on TripAdvisor, I confess I approached it with some trepidation; and was pleasantly surprised. Okay, so it won't win any awards, has no aspirations beyond what it is, and yes, it's a bit tired - in need of a refurb, but as a one night layover, it does the job. We were fortunate, we had a low floor, facing away from the runway, and weren't disturbed by aircraft noise. (No upgrade despite my platinum status, but never mind.) It's close to the airport - tick regular shuttle buses to the termnals - tick The rooms were comfortable - if a bit shabby - tick The bar was comfortable - tick The staff were attentive - tick The convenience shop was well stocked - tick The breakfast in the restaurant was fine - tick So... by my reckoning, as an airport hotel it won't win any awards, but it ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sarah09
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. It is quite run down. Luckily, we literally used the hotel to sleep off a long flight. The bathroom was quite tired (and a bit dirty) and overall the room is in need of redecoration. I definitely wouldnt stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a layover”
Reviews.Author: trvlerjenn
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of it's location, pure and simple. The shuttle at the airport was timely, check-in was seamless, the room itself was very nice. The staff had set out a sleep CD, eyemask, lavender spray for the sheets, and earplus out on the bed, which I thought was a nice touch. The bar/restaurant was actually very nice for a hotel, and quite frankly, served one of the best burgers I've had in years. Service was prompt and the prices weren't too extravagant. I do have issues with the 'wi-fi in every room'. It didn't work in my room, and I had to go down to the lobby and pay $5US in order to print out my boarding pass and do a quick check of my email. I spoke to the staff about the internet issue, but they just gave me the phone number of the service that they utilize. I phoned them, and was kept on hold for over 10 minutes, so hung up. However, all in all, I would recommend this hotel. I believe that the internet issue probably isn't an ongoing problem, and the rest of my stay was what you'd expect from arriving late, and leavin early.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs, Bugs, and more Bugs”
Reviews.Author: SallyRI
Reviews.Content: This property has a problem with bugs...lots and lots of bugs....upon arrival, we immediately became aware of a pungent odor in the hallway ...management had knowingly placed us on a floor that had an insect infestation. When we awakened in the morning, our bathroom and personal belongings were blanketed with hundreds of insects....they resembled sugar ants...they were crawling on the sink, vanity, cups, toilet, floor, and tub. It was outrageous. The initial odor that we smelled upon arrival was pesticide. Management acknowledged the insect problem, blaming it on the California drought. To compensate us, we have been offered 2 free vouchers to stay at this property again.....NEVER, NEVER,,,not even for free!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: Kmalia
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very sufficient as airport hotels go. The free shuttle took a little while to arrive at my terminal (no more than 15 minutes) but after it arrived the driver was very helpful in loading everyone up and getting us to the hotel. Check-in was fast and my room was clean and comfortable. In fact, the bed was very comfortable and linens were crisp and clean. They also give you a 'sleep kit' with a relaxing music CD, eye mask, earplugs and linen spray. Although I did not use the earplugs, I heard very little airplane noise that night, just a few taking off in the morning. There is a nice new CD player/alarm clock next to the bed, and the also guarantee wake-up calls which is good. My wake up call was right on time and my checkout was fast and efficient. This is certainly not a 'luxury' hotel - no one offered to help me with my luggage up to my room, there was no bathrobe or slippers, the restaurant and lobby did look a bit dismal and there is nothing of interest in the immediate vicinity, but overall, it is just fine for an overnight stay at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: DefiningLuxury
Reviews.Content: If it's luxury your after I'd totally leave this hotel out of the equation! I stayed here for one night as a stop over on a 24 hour flight and as much as I enjoyed being off of the plane, I couldn't wait to get back on! The Crowne Plaza LAX, is located in one of the most depressing backdrops on planet Earth! It is smackbang in the middle of the outskirts of the airport and let's be honest....it stinks!! The traffic outside is permanently still and the air is polluted from the planes! Regardless of whether you want to be near the airport, I would try and get away from it as much as possible! The entry to the hotel is very drab! The lobby has clearly been abandonned from interior upgrades as it is rather outdated! The elevators were slow and aren't the easiest to go on after a meal! The restaurant is not worth the trouble yet it appeared to be the only option, considering the hotel was nowhere near anything! The breakfast you have to pay for seperately but it's also a total rip off and to be honest.....it tastes vile! The rooms on the other hand enhanced my disappointment to a minor extent! The beds were extremely comfortable and the temperature was stop on! The bathrooms however were deplorable!! The hotel also hosts a rooftop pool and spa and a steam room and shower! That appeared to be the only major positive part of our stay there! There is also a shop off the lobby but it's hidiously expensive and I mean expensive!! To summarise everything: Take my advice.....Go elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport but sufficiently quiet; No shopping within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: Muppetbaby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza LAX just for one night on the 16th of July. It is a comfortable distance from the airport -- minutes away from the airport via their free shuttle, which is very frequent (15mins); at the same time, it is just far enough so the sound of the planes is faint. The bed was so comfortable that I slept like a baby and so, the planes did not bother me at all. I think this hotel should be ok even for light sleepers because it provides earplugs and a CD with soothing music. My reservation did not come with breakfast but there are 2 small coffeeshops in the office building next to the hotel. One of them serves coffee and a muffin for $1.99. The other has a sufficient selection of breakfast foods like sandwiches, eggs and the like. Overall, a good place to stay if you are just staying for a night and do not expect to do much shopping or partying whist you are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awful”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirlOC
Reviews.Content: Hate to have to agree with the bad reviews of this hotel but it was one of the most awful ones I have stayed in! Slow check in, unhelpful staff, dirty room, paint peeling from the walls, run down bar/restaurant, yellow bathroom (which had been white at some point many years ago!), uncomfortable bed, ancient TV - and I could go on and on! Badly badly in need of refurb - don't waste money on this, not even at Travel Lodge standard! Tarnished Crowne Plaza's reputation for us - never again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: tclapper
Reviews.Content: I arrived from an overseas flight around 11 PM. I was very tired and was getting on a flight back to Phoenix in the morning. I get in line to check-in and wait for about 15-20 minutes. There is no movement in the line and the two simpletons behind the counter are not checking anyone in. I ask if there is a problem and they say that they don't have any rooms. Well, I had booked and paid for my rooms on hotwire, so I asked about my reservation. They said that everyone was in the same situation and had confirmed reservations. We waited another 45 minutes in line before anything happened and with no update. They told us that they had rooms, but not sure which ones were available. We got this information after having to interrogate them. Finally got into my room around 12:15 and had to get up at 6:30 AM. Bravo, Crowne Plaza. your organization is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Crummy, crummy, crummy”
Reviews.Author: stace2007
Reviews.Content: First the good- the lobby looks nice. The restaurant staff was pleasant and the food was okay. The bad- the rest of the hotel is not nice. The hallways are old and smell bad and in some areas it looks like they started to refurbish and just never finished the project. My major problems related to the room key. First they gave me a key that didn't work. Then they gave someone else a key to my room who actually walked in about an hour after I got there with her bags and tried arguing that I should leave- note to self- always use the dead bolt or chain lock. Then my key wouldn't work again. When I brought this all to the attention of the front desk, they could not have cared less. The rep just shrugged his shoulders and gave me a new key. Then a few hours later, more people tried to get into my room with keys given to them by the front desk. At least this time I had used both locks so they didn't actually get in even though their key worked. I called the front desk again. This time they may have taken care of the problem because no other strangers tried to get into my room that night. I travel all the time- literally 2 or 3 weeks out of the month, and I have never had a hotel give strangers the key to my room before. I even wrote to the hotel manager a quite civil letter before posting this but he or she didn't even care enough to call, e-mail or write and explanation. Do not stay here! I could have even dealt with the filthy carpetting, lipstick encrusted glass in the bathroom (not my lipstick), and the hair on the sink (also not mine), but any hotel that engages in this kind of security breech (apparently regularly) is not safe and should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: JetsetTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on April 27 and booked it because they offered the best rate, it was a discount rate. The employees were great, we arrived very late (or early I suppose at around 12:15 Saturday morning). I was concerned that there might be a long wait for the shuttle but this fortunately was not the case at all. We only used the shuttle from the airport as we were going on a cruise departing San Pedro on Saturday. Check in was very fast, a nice thing considering we were tired and ready for bed. On arrival at the front desk they had a sign welcoming their guest of the day and it was me, much to my surprise. They gave me a basket with cheese and crackers, chocolate chip cookies, candy, and a couple of other things with a bow on it. It was a nice touch. I am assuming the recipient is selected at random, possibly from priority club members, I don't know. Additionally they upgraded us to a room in the executive floor which allowed us to use the lounge which unfortunately was closed as it was late. We weren't up early enough for the complimentary breakfast in the lounge. The room was clean as was the bathroom which to me is the most important thing, with the exception of the carpet which did have some stains and looked worn, definitely could use replacement. The room could use an update, especially the bathroom. The beds were very comfortable as were the pillows. People have mentioned the noise from passing aircraft,. While there was noise, it was not too bad just a dull low roar occasionally and not enough to keep me up or wake me up and neither my mom nor step-father complained about it so it's not a big issue. They did have a set of ear plugs but we didn't use them. The concierge was helpful with transportation to the port in the morning recommending a towncar vs. a cab, saying it cost the same. In the end it cost about $7 more than the cab ride back to the airport at the end of the cruise but oh well. Check out was also quick and efficient. Overal a nice experience at this hotel, though I was slightly disappointed. Being a Crowne Plaza I expected a little more as far as the room goes (the carpet and the bathroom) but other than that I was satisfied and the price was definitely right.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Perfectly Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: btargum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week while visiting family nearby. While we didn't spend a terrific amount of time in the hotel, we found it more than adequate. The hotel does feel a bit tired, but the bed was new and very comfortable, and the room was fairly spacious. The staff were consistently wonderful. The proximity to the airport was phenomenal, and the airport shuttle was very easy. A few helpful tidbits: 1. All the rooms face the runways to a degree. There are some rooms that face *less* runway (and are quieter) and it is worth requesting one of those, but don't expect to sleep without hearing airplanes. This is an airport hotel, after all. 2. The top two floors of the hotel are the executive floors / quiet zone. While not much different from the other floors, you do get bottled water. (It is worth noting that our water supply was a bit sporadic: some days we got one, some days none, and some days two.) 3. Parking is $12/day, though seemed to be less if you used your AAA card instead of getting the hotel discount. We didn't have our card. 4. The fitness center is small, but adequate. There are a couple of treadmills, at least one elliptical, and some weight equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kryswithak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 10 mins. from the airport. There is nothing else really around the hotel. The bed is really comfortable. There is a free trolly that goes to Manhattan Beach with shopping and restaurants. This is perfect for those here on business for Raytheon, Boeing, Northrop. The steam room was a nice touch though.

Reviews.Title: “They control what they can, some things they can't”
Reviews.Author: evilipoo
Reviews.Content: My company attended a class here so this is where I stayed... I was not looking forward to it because I usually choose a B&B when I have a choice. Having said that... I was pleasantly surprised with just about every aspect of my stay. The staff, especially was wonderful and friendly. Never did I encounter someone who did not greet me in a genuinely cheerful manner! I requested and recieved a room on a "quiet floor" and other than guests allowing the room doors to close (slam) loudly, I was undisturbed. Now there is of course some noise from the adjacent airport... Not much the hotel can do about that, but what they can, they do. Earplugs, a sleep CD, sleep mask and linen spray are thoughtfully provided. I did not need them as the planes were kind of a white noise in the background. Truthfully, I was bothered more by the sounds of the street traffic--which did lessen after 10pm or so. The room was clean and ready early. My check out was extended without issue. Room service was prompt and delicious. There was plenty of lighting in the room and the internet worked great. Oh and the shower was hot and had plenty of pressure (unlike many in So Cal)! Probably the nicest thing was that this was the first time I have stayed on a lower floor where I did not hear ANYONE walking around above me--that was GREAT! There is even a nightlight in the room (though no place to plug it in in the bathroom--which is where I would have liked it). About the only thing I did not like in the room was the heat/air unit which is noisy (like most) and since it was a wall unit, was actually the source of the aforementioned street noise entering the room. One shortcoming is the hotel restaurant... There is really only one and the menu is the same for lunch and dinner. Pricing is just ok and so is the food. I guess if I really wanted to I could have walked to a nearby hotel and checked out there restaurant, bus since I am only here for one day it was no big deal. All in all, I would stay again, but it is really not a place to vacation. It is what it is--a hotel near the airport that caters to business travelers and does it very well.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Travellinghack
Reviews.Content: I haven't used this hotel for two years and it's obviously gone down hill. Arrived to find computer system down so they weren't checking anybody in for two hours or so; when they did restart the system in the mid afternoon there was no water in the rooms --- so an already stretched check in delay after a 12 hoiur flight from NZ was made even longer --- the water was finally delivered late afternoon but proceeded by an unerving burst of muddy coloured water but by then an elevator was under repair and the wait for the otrhers was tedious. The front desk queues were long all day. Nobody from management even conceded it weas a day from hell let alone apologised for the endless problems. The restuarant is boring and the noise levels from the planes are too high. Needs more staff and some money spent on it.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for a vacation...”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen_1090
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. It was a nice hotel, better then expected. I only have one complaint. It was way too loud. I know it is an airport hotel but you can hear the huge planes landing and taking off well into the night. The nice thing is the hotel provides you with ear plugs, a sleeping mask and a Dream CD. I would not stay here for a vacation but it is tolerable for a night or if you are a sound sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Old Building, But Good, Service OK”
Reviews.Author: 911Tech
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights. The Staff was very nice. The room was good. (It could have used a refrigerator.) The HVAC was not working very well in the room. The Pool and Spa areas were not very clean. However the food was quite good. The Hotel building is old and they are in the process of making some renovations. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Jettisoned”
Reviews.Author: Southernsoftie
Reviews.Content: Arrived tired after 11hr 30 min fight and scramble to hotel bus. Queued to check in, room fine, nice view of runway. Despite double glazed spent night with fighter pilot in my head, too noisey, toned down around 4am, lucky for me! Sat night restaurant closed, due to wedding, got some chicken at pizza counter. Not up to UK Crowne Plaza standard more like low grade hotel. Platinum member 17th floor free breakfast, fruit, cereals and american style bakery products Ok. Back following week, same thing except bar open, nice spit roast chicken. Typical airport bang them in and out hotel. Served it's purpose. Pool a joke about the size of a postage stamp. Jokers lost my second booking them tried to argue I had not made one, like I would travel from Alaska without a reservation, gave them hell they gave me a room and inflated price.

Reviews.Title: “In serious need of a refit”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: In serious need of an overhaul. It's old- very old. Rooms are Ok but need to be refurbished. Elevator is from the 70's. It's extremely noisy as well. Staff need training. Service is ordinary as is the restaurant food. Not a bad hotel,just not a good one. I's stick to the Westin

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay at LAX!”
Reviews.Author: MAJ_JBM
Reviews.Content: I was in Ontario/Rancho Cucamonga on business, and although I flew in to ONT rather than LAX, my flight home on Midwest Airlines was out of LAX early on a Saturday morning. Not wanting to make a 50-mile drive on unfamiliary freeways at 6 a.m., I decided to leave a very nice Hilton Garden Inn in Ontario and go to LAX and stay at a nearby hotel the night before my flight. I chose the Crowne Plaza Hotel because I was a member of the IC Hotels Priority Club (which includes Crowne Plaza and the Holiday Inn family). I was very happy that I did. First, when I checked in, they told me that as a Platinum member of the Priority Club, they had an upgraded room available for me. Wow...a feature of a frequent flyer or guest program that really works! Of course, it's based on availability, but it's nice to get a perq without having to ask for it or point it out. The front desk and bell staff were extremely helpful and patient with me, a person who is not accustomed to staying at a full-service hotel. My room was on a "quiet" floor on which they try to place flight crews to ensure rest. That floor has an earlier noise curfew than the rest of the hotel. Each guest on that floor will find a gift pack including a complimentary eye mask, ear plugs, and even a relaxation CD! Because of the hotel's proximity to the airport and concern for noise from aircraft taking off or landing, they may offer the same gift pack in rooms on other floors. Although I didn't need the package, it's a considerate touch. The bathroom appeared a little dated, and the hotel can't help it that city water is so laced with chlorine, you'd think that you were in a swimming pool. The bed and bedding were fantastic, and the room itself was very clean and comfortable. The airport is in a mixed neighborhood, so while the "Hotel Row" itself is fairly safe, there are some places like a 24-hour US Post Office and a Burger King a few blocks away that you may want to drive to rather than walk. The hotel provides a shuttle to the airport. If you don't feel like driving around to find a meal, there are several great restaurants or snack shops downstairs.
