If I hadn't had dinner on the way to the hotel, I would have liked to try their handmade pizzas. They also have Krispy Kreme doughnuts. In general, prices seemed very reasonable for food items. Need to work off the calories? They have a good exercise room with several TVs to help take your mind off your exertions. They also have a nice outdoor pool and spa on a balcony a few floors up from ground level. I'm glad I decided to go to Crowne Plaza Hotel for the night before my flight. It's convenient, and it's comfortable. You expect more from a full-service hotel, and they deliver. This hotel is not in a trendy part of L.A. or a resort area, but for business and proximity to the airport, this is a great place to stay and a great value for the price (around $130/night).

Reviews.Title: “In Need of Some Noise Proofing”
Reviews.Author: wdharrington
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business back in May and I must say it is one of the WORST places I have ever stayed at in my life. First off only one elevator was working and after a long work day this was just another roadblock. I did not get one decent night's sleep in this dump. My room faced a runway that had traffic on it ALL night. I was told the hotel was booked and switching rooms was not an option. Seriously, I've stayed at several LAX hotels and this one has the worst noise proofing of them all. The room was also dirty. Boogers and blood on the wall and the carpet had stains as well. Also, I had to go two floors down to get a bucket of ice as my floor and the floor below me's ice machines were broken. This is not even close to a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not the worst”
Reviews.Author: johnnyc7680
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight the next day from LAX, so I found this hotel last minute on Travelocity for $125 on a Saturday night - not a bad price. Hotel lobby was nicer than I expected - restaurant was satisfactory, bar was adequate with a good number of guests having drinks, and the lobby was fine. I am a Priority Club member (same program as Holiday Inn - free to join), and I received vouchers for 2 complimentary beers, glasses of wine, or starbucks coffees. Rooms were average, the biggest perk being the very soft King size bed and the powerful shower head. I had no real problem with the room - it's perfect if you are just looking for a place to crash for one night and to get to the airport early. Had to pay a small fee for one-hour of wireless internet access, which annoys me because the Crowne Plaza's sister property, Holiday Inn Express, offers it for free, but the price was nominal. The airport shuttle came quite often and runs all night - it takes literarly 4-6 minutes to get to the terminal. It does stop at the Raddison first, but it was quick. Tip - if you are returning a rental car, most of the rental car buses will stop in front of the Crowne Plaza and drop you off instead of bringing you all the way back to the terminal - we used Dollar and they complied. There are also 2 nice, safe gas stations (Shell and 86) close to the hotel on Century Blvd, which you can stop at before returning the car. We stopped at the hotel first to check in before returning our rental car - valet attendant let me leave the car in the front while we checked in, knowing that I would be back soon to go return the car. If you exit onto Century Blvd and want to go to the aforementioned gas stations, be prepared to get into the left lane quickly to make the U-turn. I didn't move fast enough and we ended up going into LAX to turn around - an annoying detour. I definitely recommend this place for a quick stay or for one-night to head to the airport quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Riffmaster
Reviews.Content: Couple of nights here before flying home. We had booked 2 rooms but hotel had only reserved one. Staff very apologetic and sorted it out quickly-excellent! Rooms nice and spacious with good facilities including earplugs and sleeptime CD. Luckily these not required! Nice foyer with pizza/sandwich cafe and Sushi bar. Pool small but adequate with excellent spa. Had a problem with internet access as all systems appeared down. However, very helpful staff member called AJ (check him out!) went heaven and earth to find me an access point. What terrific service. Highly recommended hotel

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service - This hotel is for one night, not for holiday”
Reviews.Author: Hordakker2
Reviews.Content: I was deeply disappointed when arriving at the hotel. The staff at the reception seemed very unfriendly to me. To my surprise, my room rate of 129 USD had no breakfast included, staff's comment was "What do you expect for that rate" - bad attitude. I stayed in 55 USD Hotels that were far better (Japanese Hotel in Downtown LA). The beds are ok, but rooms are somewhat smallish. The walls in the pathways are old and dirty, the wooden frames have so many itches, you wonder if you're in a cheap motel. I asked for technical advice, but 20 minutes later still no body helped me. The technician that finally came was the only nice person in the hotel, he told me that reception staff is very moody and does often not care about requests as many guests anyway only stay one night.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly all in one hotel”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: Wow! What an interesting place. I was one of the guests lucky enough to get a west-facing room -- overlooking the LAX south runways, no less. There are people here who checked into this hotel for this experience, and the views from this wing are spectacular. LAX, though, is an important international airport and operates 24/7. There is noise, and some of the worst is between 11pm and midnight when many trans-Pacifics are landing. Some guests have cameras at the ready, and others have stuffed cotton wool in their ears. I checked in at 1am after a late flight from the east coast and had to stand in line. Like the airport, this hotel is gangbusters 24/7. Flight crews are boarded here, and so are many TSA personnel. They are allowed to check in first. It then took about half an hour to get my keys, check in my rental car (the hotel does not own the parking garage) and register for the 9.95 a day wireless Internet service. Then, up on the 15th floor, I could hear a party in one of the rooms going great gun as I carted my rollerbag down the hallway to my room. Those guests checked out the next day, and new ones checked in. One of this hotel's problems might be the turnover -- not too many guests seem to stay more than one night. My room was smallish, but it seemed clean. The bathroom had plenty of towels (see photos) and the maid kept me well supplied with amenities -- even a little bottle of lavender water to spray the linens with. The bed was very comfortable -- almost up to premium standards. The staff worked very hard, yet this property would be hard-put to pass a white-glove test. It's simply too busy. If you want to find a scrape, a skuff or a fray, you will. The only real problem with my room (1529) was that there was no way for the fix-it guys to keep my H/AC unit from dripping water on the floor. A whole section of carpet near the window was sopping wet and never dried properly. Big deal; maybe next time I'll have a different room with a dry carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Might be one star too high”
Reviews.Author: cdnclub
Reviews.Content: Hotel is often listed as 3 stars. We stayed 1 night for an early flight out of LAX. For an airport hotel it served it's purpose but I would not say from a room perspective it was necessarily 3 stars--the carpet was stained and seemed dirty. The bathroom was on the smaller side and we would not have wanted to take a bath. On the positive side, the bed was quite comfortable, the air conditioning worked well, and the front desk and bell stand people were friendly. There is a free airport shuttle but on the way to the airport allow extra time as the shuttle stops at the neighboring Radisson and it might take a while to get to your specific terminal-if time is imperative, line up a cab. We used priceline to book the room which made the cost for the stay reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: vegasbuffet
Reviews.Content: This is a great upper-class hotel overall; price is about right what you get. Room was gorgeous and luxurious. Front desk and staff very nice and helpful. I had a room facing west, but the airline noise was not bad at all. I highly recommend the club level, which is the private top floor, which was so quiet. I never heard any neighbors. I hardly saw any other guests either. It has a private lounge area for only that floor with free drinks and snacks. Some minor irritations I had that you should be aware of: (1) parking will cost you $12 a day to park in the garage, even though you are a hotel guest. I don't like paying for parking when I am a guest. (2) Pool is small and nothing special, but they do have a decent jacuzzi. I could not find any clean towels around the pool, so I had to use ones from my room. Overall, I would stay here again, but only at the club level.

Reviews.Title: “Give It a Miss if Possible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight before catching an onward flight to London from Auckland. Very, very disappointed with the room. It could have done with a complete upgrade and refit. Being a smoker we opted for a smoking room, and must say, that the whole floor absolutely stank of stale smoke, and that is from a smoker!!! Also, can you believe it, a smoking room with no ashtray!! We have never noticed this before in a hotel, and we are seasoned travellers. OK, they do give you earplugs and eye masks but only for one person in a twin bedded room!!! We also had to pay $32 for a short telephone call to the UK (made from our room) to confirm our time of arrival next day - I believe a phone card would have cost about $10 and we would have had twice as much talking time. Staff reasonably helpful. Having paid at least 25% more for this room than a room we had during our trip out to Auckland at the Marriott, there is no comparison, go for the Marriott everytime, it is just one block away from the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: GalenaGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to LAX and has a reasonable "park and fly" package which includes covered parking for up to 7 days along with the room rate for one night, about $189. The facilities are adequate, but the staff is rude. The valet just laughed at me when I arrived and could not have been less helpful or welcoming. The shuttle bus driver was worse, hostile to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night between flights home from Tahiti. I read the mixed reviews but got what I thought was a very fair price online so decided to try it. I was very happy we did. We landed at LAX and waited approximately 15 to 20 minutes for the free shuttle to pick us up. We arrived at the hotel and found check-in to be very quick and easy. Our room with king-size bed looked out across the street to the airport. While we could make out some airport noise, it was fairly well muffled and didn't prevent us from getting to sleep. The room was clean and comfortable with plenty of towels and toiletries. The hotel itself was, in my opinion, very clean and well kept up. LAX is obviously an old airport and the surrounding hotels reflect that but the Crowne stood out from the others to me. We stopped by the concierge desk for advice on sight-seeing and found the gentleman who helped us polite and informative. At his suggestion, we took the 40 minute bus ride to Santa Monica but opted to take a $20 cab back as we felt it would be faster and more comfortable. Upon returning, we stopped by the restaurant for some desert and found the staff to be attentive and the food average. We woke up the next morning and were checked out and loaded on the shuttle quickly and with no hang-ups. I agree with previous reviews that this is not a good location for tourists but if you are on business or in between flights with some time to kill, I think this is a fine hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to tell this was an airport area hotel”
Reviews.Author: marstar694
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza 3/28 to 3/31/06. Although this hotel was very close to the airport, it was actually very difficult to tell. The rooms were clean (loved the duvet and confortable pillows!) The hotel provided a nice gift bag of relaxation tape, earplugs, and sleeping mask but we never needed any of them. We could hardly hear any jet noise even though the airport was just across the street! The pool and hot tub were fantastic (unlike a previous review, the hot tub was perfect the days we were there) and the kids loved experiencing the steam room. I slept better at this hotel than the 4.5 star hotel I stayed at later in the week). Although there wasn't a lot of foo-foo amentities, this hotel would be perfect for someone needing to stay close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay at this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a tiring flight from Winnipeg to Los Angeles, I needed to rest for 7 hours before my long haul flight to Malaysia. I went to Travelers Aid at LAX and leafed through their folder for a hotel which had a hot tub because my back was killing me and I really needed to relax before my 16 hour flight to Malaysia. Travelers Aid was very helpful and called several hotels that advertised hot tubs. When Crowne Plaza was contacted, they informed Travelers Aid that their hot tub was working so I checked in with them. The room was okay so I took a nap, had dinner, and then changed to check out the hot tub. That's when I received my rude shock. The so-called working hot tub was cordoned off with yellow warning tape, like a scene from CSI, and when I crawled beneath the tape and dunked my toes into the water, it was freezing cold! I thought perhaps it wasn't turned on so I turned it on. The bubbles came up but the water remained cold while I sat beside the freezing "hot" tub for 15 minutes, shivering my butt off! I went upstairs, completely distressed, and complained to the front office, who, instead of apologizing for it, blamed Travelers Aid, who had done absolutely nothing wrong. Later, when I checked out, they wouldn't look me in the eye and were quite rude when I tried to get my valuables out of the safe deposit box. They wouldn't help me when I told them I didn't know how to work the funky box and finally, after shoving around, I managed to get it open. Please do not stay at this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Ambitious 3 star rating .. adequate airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTripper
Reviews.Content: Overnighted here on transit; the hotel is merely adequate for an overnight stay .. definitely not a 3* other than for the name. * Decent shuttle service in and out of the airport * Cleanish rooms * Below-average beds and paraphenalia

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonReview
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and was pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and comfortable with luxury duvet, pillows etc. The bathroom was fairly spacious and the room service food was good although on the expensive side. It was also convenient having a free shuttle to and from LAX airport. The only downside is the fact that you do hear the planes nearby but since this is a hotel near the airport this is to be expected and did not affect us sleeping! Overall a very comfortable stay and a definite a place I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: TaraR
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family in 2 rooms for one night before early flight from LAX. We basically just checked in to the hotel, returned the rental car, used the fitness center (which was really nice for a hotel) and went to bed. Check in / Check out was fast and painless. I used the entertainment book rate of 59 / night which I thought was great. Rooms were nice althought the bathroom shower could have been cleaner. Airport shuttle was fast. I would recommend to anyone wanting a hotel close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a hotel airport”
Reviews.Author: pneyu
Reviews.Content: Pricelined it for $55 for one night, and it was fine. The beds were great, parking wasn't bad, and the airport shuttle was very handy. You definitely need a car if you're going to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good registration people”
Reviews.Author: catulla
Reviews.Content: We had an experience like the last reviewer. Our Australian travel agent booked us into the airport Crowne Plaza instead of the Beverly Hills one (after recommending the latter!). However, one of the reception staff was very helpful and managed to transfer us to the correct hotel. Their English was fine. The only problem was that when we asked for a taxi, the concierge got us a car with no meter, which was more expensive than a taxi.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Los Angeles International Airport Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5985 W. Century Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90045
